Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: RHODY27
Reviews.Content: We were on a school trip with our son. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are big, bathrooms small, decor a little worn. But room was clean and the hotel has a nice view of a park. Great brunch in the hotel. Again staff is very friendly and willing to help!

Reviews.Title: “A warm place to sleep....that's it.”
Reviews.Author: rungirlsl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty disappointing, but is in walking distance to L' Olympia (which is a good thing). The parking garage is terrifying. I nearly hit my head on pipes when I got out of my car. Park at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, not so good area”
Reviews.Author: mbeaumont
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, I was able to have an early check in, which was great since my bus arrived at 11am, and wanted to get settled in the room early. Great view from top floor, only decide is neighborhood, constantly tormented from homeless people and vagrants each time I went outdoors or to the subway. Otherwise I would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Great Place In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jace898
Reviews.Content: We booked this place over the Easter weekend. We were there from Thursday to Monday. Staff were very friendly, the place was clean. The rooms where clean and fairly big compared to other hotels I've stayed in. Most important the beds were extremely comfortable. Coffee/tea maker in room. Would have been nice to have a little fridge. They also have free high speed wifi. A decent pool, great to getaway, and also a sauna. The breakfast in the hotel is expensive. Parking in the hotel is expensive aswell. 18$ a day. Would have been nice if parking was free, considering you are renting the rooms. Location was perfect. With in walking distance to everything, restaurants, shopping, bars, parks, subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: rileymacdonald
Reviews.Content: We drove to Montreal on Friday and decided to spend the night at the last minute. I booked a room on Hotwire. I was told that I would get a hotel such as the Hilton or the intercontinental. I got this place. We drove to it and found a parking spot on the street outside the hotel - what are the odds! We check in and are advised to move our car because of the people who hangout in the park which is where we had parked along. We were given our room with a Queen size bed - the front desk clerk asked us if we wanted to upgrade the room for 25.00. I said no, it was already almost 10 and we were going out. What was the point. We go up to our room. It was right against the elevators. I heard every elevator go up and down throughout the night. The room was ok - nothing special. Old furniture, tube tv, old phone. Bed was ok. It was clean and that's all that matters. i don't think this hotel should be comparable to a Hilton or anything. Perhaps a Best Western. It's not the best area at night. The underground parking was insane to get through. It was just one night and it served it's purpose but I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: DrBruceW
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited from out of town and booked this hotel through Hotwire. After reading reviews, we were hesitant of the quality of the hotel... but, upon arriving, we were greeted by a friendly smile and accommodating front desk. They were able to change our room to double bed (we were given a single queen sized bed by Hotwire), offer early check in, as well as late check out. Special thanks to Julie for great service! While the hotel was older and the furnishings and decor dated, the beds were very comfortable with clean and soft sheets. The location is very central, being right on top of a metro station and 2 blocks away from the Greyhound bus station. If you found this on Hotwire, don't judge it based on some of the other critical reviews... overall, we were impressed by the hotel's combination of value, service, convenience, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Sjohnott
Reviews.Content: Arrived with my wife and 2 small children and was told that our room was a single king room.I was told there was nothing else he could do as hotwire rooms are booked as a block with whatever type of room the hotel wants . He offered to speak with the manager to see how much to upgrade to a suite. The Manager (Ramzi Ben Mansour) came out and offered us an excecutive suite at no extra charge. We got to the suite and everything about it was perfect ,There was a view from the port to mont Royal.Amazing .We spent alot of time people watching out those gigantic windows...The housekeeping staff helped us set up the pull out bed and brought us extra pillows ,with a smile.Nice size pool ,the kids really enjoyed.. We will definitly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied - good value”
Reviews.Author: Hotdog18
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and was pleased and if I come to Montreal again, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here. I was surprised to read of poor housekeeping problems because I have never encountered any problems. The buffet breakfast was fine. There is a shopping center connected to the hotel so you can purchase many items without even having to go outside which is very convenient if it's cold. I found the staff to be pleasant. The cost was very reasonable so we definitely got good value. There is a small gym which was sufficient and a clean pool, although it would have been nice if it was a little warmer

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained, very poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: OttawaJman1
Reviews.Content: We booked 6 rooms here through Hotwire for a group trip, arrived on March 14th for 1 night. I have used Hotwire on about 5-6 times before and have always found that the hotels supplied were easily at or above my expectations. Unfortunately, not this time... I must first say that this is NOT a 4-star hotel as advertised. I believe if it were advertised as 3-star, I would be only slightly disappointed. All 6 rooms which were booked were on the same floor, and all were booked as non-smoking double bed accommodation. I will simply list items of concern that were noted among the 6 rooms that were booked. -one room had one of the beds and the box-spring leaning up against the wall (????) -in 3 of the 6 rooms, the beds were not even made, some had bedding piled in the corner -unbearable cigarette/cigar smoke smell in 2 of the 6 rooms -in one room, one-third of the room has soaking wet carpet from leaking water -at least 1 room had no pen/paper, no garbage can, NO TOILET PAPER (????) -the shower heads were very poor, didnt work properly -the water came out like a firehose -the faucet in one of the showers actually fell off when you tried to use it... -rooms had windows left open and the heat turned completely off (it was 4c outside) These were just the most obvious items in a long list of poor, smelly, strange and unacceptable items that we noted. I obviously would not recommend this hotel, and I now have reservations about Hotwire. I intend to contact Hotwire to advise them that until this stay, they have exceeded expectations on hotel choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Funky, and Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: OKDear
Reviews.Content: I was worried, based on some of the reviews talking about old fittings and threadbare carpets, etc. However, I was very happy with Hotwire's choice, even without considering the great deal. Yes, the management should sort out the carpets in the hallways - they're not worn out, but the seams have large threads coming out of them - hire a teenager with a knife for a day. And yes, as someone else pointed out, the lamps and such are clearly deliberately old...but I thought it was kind of funky. We had the standard room, which was clean, well equipped, and comfortable. The staff was pleasant, but there were some signs of 'hotwire' treatment. Although we checked in a 4:30, there were already no queen beds available, nor any business-class rooms in the advertised $20 upgrade, and we were first 'offered' a room by the elevator. In summary, great location, comfortable stay, and excellent deal. And...the reason I wrote this review which so far echos other people...the restaurant was OUTSTANDING, which will be the subject of it's own review from me.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations based on many of the reviews here!”
Reviews.Author: abigllama
Reviews.Content: Landed here for a two night stay via Hotwire and got an excellent rate. Familiar with Montreal but had never stayed here and many of the reviews kept expectations way low. The location was central and convenient. Parking is $18.50 a day, pretty standard for the area, with in and out options available but with the metro stop right next to the hotel didn't need the car at all. Check in was friendly, fast and no Hotwire snooty stuff. Thanks to a tripadvisor review tip, we called a few days earlier to request a non-smoking room and this was granted at check in. The room up on the 23rd floor was comfortable and very clean. Everything was a bit dated, carpets and one of the chairs was a bit worn, tv was an old one, but not a big deal. The bathroom looked like it had been refurbished a bit, and it was also very clean. The water pressure was kind of weak on the shower but it got the job done. The location is great and not sure where all of the safety concerns are coming from. Montreal is a major city and the hotel is located next to a park that can be sketchy at night. But the sketchy people in the park are pretty contained and keep to themselves other than some pan handling near the street. You don't have to give them money but treat them with respect and they will do the same. None of this spilled over into the hotel or the parking garage on the weekend we were there. It would probably be a bad idea to wonder around in the park alone at night, but that's general urban common sense. We'd gladly stay here again. Even with the dated rooms, the cleanliness, location and value more than make up for the minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Needs a Refreshment”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: Travelled for Business, April 2011. Stayed 2 nights. Pros : Hotel is in Montreal Downtown. You can get everywhere you want within a 15 minutes walk. Prices are cheap compared to other hotels. Altought the rooms are ugly, they were clean and quiet. Cons: Hotel environment is awkward - Hotel is at ''Place Dupuis'' and this place has the sad reputation of being the headquarter of junkies and ''street female workers'' in Montreal downtow. Would not let my girlfriend alone on St-Hubert Street at this place after 10pm. Room furniture is Old and decrepit. Room decoration is dated back from the 70's.... This includes cigarette burns all over the furniture.... But beds and washroom were clean. Bottom line: Hotel was OK for a 2 days stay. Nothing fabulous here but it was OK. Hotel is rated 4 stars... It's more like a 3.5 stars... At 75$ per night, this is OK. Will return at this price...

Reviews.Title: “Would not have been my first choice, but didn't feel ripped off.”
Reviews.Author: mginsb8256
Reviews.Content: Was given this property via an opaque site. When the name first came up I was like "huh"? and then when I read some of the reviews I got a knot in my stomach. It actually was not as bad as some reviewers make it out to be. Check in was fast. We drove up from New York, and arrived in the evening after the rush. The desk clerk was polite and professional. When I crossed the lobby a little later, he addressed me by name asking if everything was ok. The parking garage is currently undergoing some sort of renovation. It is open, but its a bit of a mess, and finding a spot can be a bit of a hassle I think we paid 19.00 per day. ALSO..look for the signs that will guide you to an elevator that will take you into the hotel lobby. We did not, and ended up in an adjacent office building, and then had to walk outside to get to the reception area of the hotel. The room itself was clean. However, I must agree with the reviewers that state everything is old. Indeed the TV s a bit bulky, and the furniture has seen better days.The bed was ok..but just. Te room had a coffee maker, but no room safe, which is something I like to use. We were on the 11th floor with a view of Mount Royal, and a park below, that had interesting colored panels. The location was well suited for tourism, being right on top of a subway station (We left our car in the garage the whole time) Several reviewers commented on the panhandlers. I did not see any directly in front of the hotel. When we got into the subway, my son (age 12) summed it up perfectly.. "Music and homeless people again" We do a fair amount of travelling, so obviously this was not a new concept to him. Unfortunately, my son wasn't feeling well, so we had to cut our trip short. Check out was quick and the bill was correct (Only incidentals, because it was prepaid) I would not go out of my way to recommend this property, but if someone travelling on a tight budget asked for my opinion, I'd say this was fine.

Reviews.Title: “If Hotwire or Priceline put you here, don't panic...it's OK.”
Reviews.Author: skipsterNewYork
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay in Feb. 2012. Comparing this hotel as a 3* or 4* to another 3* or 4* is the wrong approach. Look at this hotel for the price paid and compare it based on price paid in other stays regardless of star level. We paid $72 for a double "classic" room via Hotwire blind buy. Even in this Feb. low season that's literally half of the AAA rate of a global chain in Old Town and probably upwards of 70% off of the unrestricted rate of some downtown properties. So, let's pause for a moment and realize that $72 is a steal for almost anything these days. For that price, as a blind item, I say no problem. I would never choose the property, on my own, however, and I don't think I'll be a regular Hotwire customer as a result (but that's a discussion for another forum thread). Pros: 1. Location just east of downtown at UQAM and edge of the Latin Quarter. I disagree with earlier reviewers who said that panhandlers were problematic. Sure it was present in the walkways of the Metro. It's a major city, people. Tell me where there isn't panhandling in the downtown of a major city and then we'll talk. We are family with 12-year old and we didn't feel unsafe for a second. 2. Metro and small shopping area is downstairs--you need not go outside. Really nice upscale grocery adjacent to the hotel when you enter the underground are from the hotel lobby. Banque Nationale on the same block for currency exchange. In no way is this a commercial for them, but their exchange rates were quite fair and fees for the exchange nominal $4 or $5. Just FYI on that. Several restaurants within walking distance that appeared decent. 3. Hotel itself, rooms and pool were all clean and housekeeping is adequate. Our bathroom had stained grout and peeling wallpaper but that was the worst offense. Clean carpets, no nightmare stains on linens, etc. 4. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Cons: 1. Old. I mean, old old. As in worn out. As in threadbare. This doesn't mean it wasn't clean, it was just beyond old. Furnishings were 30 years old if they are a day. See attached pictures. 2. Room was small. Not intolerable. But small. Obviously, we were in a "classic" room, so I can't comment on any higher offerings. Forgive me but I'm actually a little obsessed with this "old" thing. Like it's a puzzle. I don't know the Gouverneur (Canadian) chain, but I'm wondering if this is their "clearance" property? You know how department stores send their inventory to some far off store in a strip mall somewhere in the suburbs? That's kind of what this was like. Or, you know how you can wait 6-9 months after a movie is new and go see it for a $1 or $2 at a far off theater that is worn? That's kind of what this was like. Was the mortgage on this building paid off so long ago that everything is pure gravy now so why invest because of competition? Or, they could truly be serving the "B" list market (which I was a part of with my Hotwire buy). Looks like tour groups come through here also. I really think that this hotel makes an effort to keep it old. It wasn't that things were broken. Everything worked. Rather, it's like anything that needs replacing is tended to with inventory that is from some hotel clearance world. Bamboo-themed lamps? Must have been flown in from a Waikiki hotel that was redone. Beds with dips in the middle and yet I slept ok. The Zenith TVs from 1985 you have seen mentioned in other reviews is true. I mean, they have to be buying these wholesale from some chain off an interstate highway that got rid of them. I don't think you can get the cathode tube parts for these things anymore so my guess is that when the TVs start to go, they'll pick up another lot from a hotel that was renovated and put them here. Wall sconces in the hallways that are the kind from Home Goods or Home Depot that look like candles where the paper is wrapped around the front and is peeling. It's still a conference center hotel, so you look at the old felt board in the lobby with gold letters and you have to laugh a little. If you read my other reviews, I don't pick apart wall sconces. Rather, I have this list here because it can't be an accident. You have to try hard to have stuff this old. To reiterate, at $72 we were placed in safe, dry, clean surroundings with amenities. But the circa 1980 time warp doesn't make it a property "of choice".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front desk service with great views to the west.”
Reviews.Author: Napali
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fairly standard for this type of hotel, so there was really no differentiation there. But points worth noting include the excellent service from the front desk staff, a great location just east of the more busy areas of St. Catherine's with the restaurants of St. Denis and St. Laurent easily walkable. Our room was on a higher floor facing west and had sweeping views from the St. Lawrence across the city to Mont Royal. This alone was good reason to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, nice view, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvene
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right at the Berri-UQUAM metro station. As an urban hotel and right at an Urban University as well as a small urban square right across from the front doors, expect to find the usual bums and street people huddling around the corner. That aside, Montreal is a pretty safe city and I always saw police patrolling the area. The hotel itself is also connected to Dupuis place through their underground for shopping and a large food court. Also being smack dab in the Latin Quarter, the convenience and location just cannot be beat. The room I had was on the 10th floor with a beautiful view of the river and the Jacques-Cartier Bridge. The furnishings were a little dated and the bed a little hard for my liking, but plenty of different pillows (with extras in the TV cabinet drawers) made up for it. The coffee carafe was dirty which indicated a little less care in the house-keeping than I would have liked, but the towels were clean and fluffy, the shampoo/lotions provided were by Neutrogena and the tub clean. The bathroom fan though, was loud enough to wake the dead. For a 3 1/2 star hotel - I would have expected glasses and porcelain mugs in the room, not styrofoam ones, and butter pats and milk served, rather than the little sealed "no-refrigeration required" tubs you would find at a diner. Other than that, the service was good and the chocolate lava cake excellent. The staff were very helpful throughout my short stay and most spoke excellent English. If I had remembered my swimsuit, I could review the spa, but I did meet a family on the elevator who enjoyed it thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Gouverneur Place Dupuis very good”
Reviews.Author: oc3anz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in late January 2012. The staff was efficient and willing to speak English to help our dreadful French; the room was clean and warm although we had trouble regulating the room temperature. The hotel is attached to an indoor shopping plaza with a food court for immediate kid-friendly dining. The pool is not large but enough to please the kids; we didn`t try the spa. The parking garage was under reconstruction and a tight fit for our Mazda, by no means a large car. The hotel is a 15-20 min walk to old Montreal. It is in the down-town area, so there are many homeless in the area, but the view was amazing, the staff excellent and I would choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable. Great value !”
Reviews.Author: Melanie P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of January 12. Â We called in without a reservation and we got a really good room on the 25th floor with a beautiful view of Ste-Catherine. Â The clerk was very helpful and friendly yet professional. Â The room was a superior, nicely refurbished with nice furniture. The floor was very quiet and we didn't hear any sound from our neighbours. Â It was clean although we found some toast crumbs next to the bed and a bit of dust behind the bedside table. Â However, the bathroom was very clean. Â Â We decided to stay at this hotel because we were going to a hockey game and since the hotel is right above the Berry-UQAM metro station, we could make it to the Bell Centre without having to wear our winter coats !!! How cool is that ?! Â The next morning, we had breakfast at their buffet and it was very good and the service was excellent. Â Julio was our server. Â We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to MontrÃ©al.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like A VIP Always”
Reviews.Author: Lance32
Reviews.Content: This review is written by a long time guest at this Hotel. For 10 years I have spent New Years Weekend at this Hotel, where I am treated as an Honored Guest/Family member. I DISAGREE WITH THE FOLLOWING AREA AROUND HOTEL IS DANGEROUS ROOMS DATED ........... I have stayed in all types of Hotels from the age of -1. I have stayed at Everything from a simple ski lodge to the Most expensive Hotels in the World. Beverly Hills Hotel, Peninsula Beverly Hills, Plaza Hotel NYC. The area around the Hotel is VERRRY SAFE. I have walked the streets at all hours and have had no Problem. Hello people just say NO TO all people that approach you!!!! as a Retired Educator who taught in a Ghetto I speak with experience. First this Neighborhood is Like NYC Whether i am at 940 Park Ave, or any address. People on streets harmless!!!!! Rooms. The people inmhoa stay in the Standard Rooms and are Machas. Yiddish for trying to get better for no Money. I have stayed in all 3 levels of rooms. You want a Nicer room you pay more, like anywhere else. In No other City can I stay on a Business Floor 5 stars for these rates. The Staff: Lino the Room manager down to the Room Cleaners "GO OUT OF THE WAY TO MAKE YOUR VISIT SPECIAL" This Trip I had 2 non related hotel Problems involving my Lost Coat. Phone calls to all places I visited the previous day were called to no Avail. My jacket was located by Dave from Security, and Hand Delivered to my Room. I find that people need to ask for help DURING THE VISIT, NOT AFTER. I do not work for any Hotel, nor do i write reviews as a favor. The Place Dupuis is my Favorite Hotel in the WORLD. I am greeted by name every year, as Jon. if you have any specific questions post them. I am extremely critical, and have yet in 10 years to have any issues that were not addressed quickly. As the Son of a Retired Military Officer, The Hotel treats me better then any Embassy that i have visited. 6 Stars to The Place Dupuis!!!

Reviews.Title: “BACK FOR NEW YEARS”
Reviews.Author: muscletongue3000
Reviews.Content: was back to montreal and the hotel gouverneur for new years. hotel was packed and busy, but staff very helpful and friendly. room were more than ample and the bathrooms have to be the best and cleanest in montreal! inspite of the crowds in and around the hotel, noise level was nil! spa was closed during the weekend. booking site offers a number of price options and inspite of being new years the rates were not inflated. have stayed at hotel four times this year -- this is my preferred hotel in montreal as it is on top ofthe metro system and connected to it. there is a drug store and supermarket accessible within the complex.

Reviews.Title: “So, so”
Reviews.Author: JFLND
Reviews.Content: Nice location, convenient access to metro and shopping but was not very impressed with the room or the hotel in general. Limited amenities. Old furniture. Relatively small rooms. And really no view to speak of. I got the room through an Expedia blind booking for a trip in October where city hotels where booked solid for apparently a major medical conference. For the price I paid I can't much complain but nothing compels me to return.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. if Price is a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: ddjd1358
Reviews.Content: Once a first class stay, this property is not aging well. Old furnishings and worn carpets, tvs with the worst possible reception, completely inadequate water pressure, a pool that was not open during my stay with no advance notice and a front desk that seemed annoyed I showed up made this a good choice only because I got a discount deal. Don't pay the retail for this propoerty as you can do better in Montreal. The location is central and handy to public transportation althought not an area for families and the hotel still has one of the better breakfast and lunch buffets around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Sharred
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with my stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and had lots of helpful tips for getting around the city. Although not ultra modern, the room was very clean and comfortable. A problem with my television reception was dealt with promptly by hotel repare staff. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet, but there are nearby options. One of the biggest positives and negatives for this hotel is the location. It is right on the metro line, so you can be anywhere in the city in no time. It's walking distance to Old Montreal and is right near the Village. Quartier des Spectacles, where the Jazz Fest is held, is a short stroll along Ste. Catherine St. However, the hotel is located in a rather sketchy area. There are a lot of homeless/vagrant types around, and that can cause one to feel unsafe, especially after dark. That being said, my stay was very good and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility, excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: Jayemwright
Reviews.Content: Located right on Ste. Catherine's street, we found this hotel to be clean, well-run and inexpensive ($112 with CAA discount) Parking was only $17.50 per night and was inside and allowed you to come and go. The view from our room was right up Ste. Catherine's street, with Mount Royal on the right and the vieux port on the left. Staff was friendly and efficient, and the complimentary continental breakfast was great. We will definitely stay there again when we visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay but the other reviews are true.”
Reviews.Author: k-existence
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel on priceline for $70. So it was good value for the stay and worth it. The rooms are outdated and you can tell in the bathroom. The faucets and bathtub tiles looked old but it was very clean. Regardless, I wouldn't pay regular price for it. It isn't a 4 star hotel. The lobby area was nice and the staff was friendly at check in. We checked in at 3:30pm to try to get what we want. However, we ended up with one smoking and one non-smoking room. Naturally, they told us that the priceline rooms were not guaranteed so there was nothing they could do. We did get our two double bed types tho. Location is good and bad. It's very close to Berri station and touristy sites. But the area gets little sketchy at night... Lots of people around the area some tourists, some homeless/sketchy. I wouldn't feel safe walking alone at 1am. But if your in a group of friends it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for village, dated interior (but good bed!)”
Reviews.Author: IncurableTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Oct. It has a great location for the village and is right across the square from a subway line as well as the airport express bus stop. The room was fine though about what I expected for the price. It was clean but nothing fancy. The bed was very comfortable though. Doors a little thin and we thought we could hear into the next room every now and then. If being near Stereo or the village is important and you aren't the B&B type, I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth more than a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Sal093
Reviews.Content: First, Hotel.com rated this hotel a 3 and a half star. Definitely NOT!! As you know, when you pre-book with Hotel.com, you have to trust their judgement. As such, we had to actually check in, before finding out if we could have a room with two double beds. Wound up in a smoking room, because they said that was all they had available with two double beds! The room absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke, to the point that it was extremely hard to sleep. Next day we demanded to be moved to a non-smoking room. They put us in room facing the rear of the hotel. Ironically, the first room had a great view right down St Catherine St.! Talk about having it backwards. Long story short, don't stay there unless you are a smoker. Even then you may be disappointed. There are a lot of better hotels than this one in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gouverneur Hotel in October 2011. The hotel has a sign on the front of the entrance that shows it as a "4-star" hotel, but this must be out of "20-stars". I had more than a few problems. My room was very small. Upon first glance, it looked fine. The rooms look as if they were last decorated in the 80s. First, I noticed that 3 of the 4 lamps in the room were broken. When going to turn on the lamp, the bulbs fell over sideways, exposing wiring. Dangerous. Additionally, the robe hanging in the closet was shredded. Yes, shredded. I don't understand why a maid would put one back in the closet like that. I moved rooms. The second room was on the other side of the wall with the elevator shaft. Every 10-20 seconds, the elevator flew by making a racket. The third room smelled like an ashtray, although it was a non-smoking room. But the smoking rooms were just beneath!!! Oh, and there was a tan-colored stain on one of the bedsheets... very disturbing. I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully a good experience”
Reviews.Author: jefflwelch
Reviews.Content: I recently took a last minute Fall vacation to Montreal. It wasn't planned, so I was doing things on somewhat of a budget. I got my hotel "blindly" on Hotwire and I was awarded the Hotel Gouverneur Place Dupuis for $88/nite. Once I got the name of the hotel, I immediately went to their website. I was impressed. I then went to other sites like Tripadvisor and others to read traveler reviews. I started to get nervous because some reviews were not so good. However, at that point my reservation was pre-paid and could not be cancelled. Many travelers remarked about being placed in smoking rooms. I called the hotel and put in a request for a non-smoking room. Still, I packed air freshner and a candle just incase I was put in a smoking room. Overall, I was pleased with my stay! My request for a non-smoking room was honored. Also upon check-in, I asked for a renovated room, which was honored as well. Could the hotel use a little updating? Yes. However, for the price and location it couldn't be beat! The location is probably the best feature of the hotel. It is connected to a shopping center with a grocery store and Metro station. Other Metro stations are within walking distance. It's also a quick walk to The Village, Old Montreal, The Latin Quarter and shopping on St. Catherine Street. I didn't use any ammenities such as the fitness center or business center, so I can't comment on those things. However for accomodations, I was pleased and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel and clean”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle67
Reviews.Content: We got a deal to stay in Montreal in order to party a little. To our surprise, the hotel was well located right downtown Montreal close to shopping and restaurant. It was really clean even if located downtown. Good deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean...but...so-so beds and not the best neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: bwp11
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3.5* hotel via Hotwire and got the Gouverneurs in Montreal on St. Hubert. I must admit that my room was clean and the hotel was quiet. The location is close the Latin Quarter (if that's of interest). That being said, I probably wouldn't return. My problem with the hotel is: - the bed was old and had an annoying "dip" in the middle - the location is not exactly central (and St. Hubert is not a place to hang out at night) - the hotel is neither a 4 or 3.5 star in my opinion (as was rated by Hotwire... and definitely not a 4star as described on the outside of the hotel entrance) as the hotel is a little "tired" Anyhow, for the price, I'd rather have spend a bit more to get a better location and better bed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Gtag1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel during a family trip. I did not really know what to expect because of the mixed reviews. I can now tell you, do yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel. The hotel is located in "The Village" area. It is full of homeless people. However, they did not bother us. The rooms are old and smelly. It is definitely in need of an upgrade. The service desk was OK but then again we did not ask for anything. It should be rated at 2 1/2 stars at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ampersand
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for three nights, booked through Hotwire. We were very happy with the quality of the room (very good for a 3.5 star), and the location is of course fantastic if you need to use public transport (it is a short 3 minuted walk indoor to all three metro lines). As mentioned in other reviews, the rooms are slightly tired (notably the bathroom), but this didn't both us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Stay”
Reviews.Author: imapicky1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a business meeting. The hotel was chosen by our host, due to its ideal proximity to our club meeting location. It was also near the Metro, which was nice. This is a large hotel, 4 stars rated. We did not find the property to our expectations. The room was bare bones. Cheap coffee and skimpy on the shampoo. I was lucky they had conditioner. The bath mat was moldy and so we didn't use it. We had to change out our key cards 3 times before I was actually locked out of the room. The concierge came up to help only after I complained. The security manager came up as well. They were less than pleasant with me and treated me like I was a pain in the ___, until they realized the keypad was broken. They then apologized and fixed the problem. We requested a wake up call and never got it. The electrical outlets on one side of the room didn't work. A lamp had a missing on/off switch. I called right away to have it fixed but in 5 days, no one addressed the problem. Also, the concierge was not very helpful and was actually misleading when we wanted to tour the Molson Brewery and found they never even give tours. Find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dump, Great for Location to Stumble Home from the Village”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: This place is maybe 3 stars for pushing 4-star price. It gets the price it commands because of its proximity to the Village, so if that's what you want, you're golden. The Village itself is kind of a dump, so the likelihood that the owner will ever invest much in this aging property is very limited. There's no investment incentive, when the hotel can commend as high a room night price point without any effort "as is?"

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and aged hotel... definitely not a "4 Star"”
Reviews.Author: FWM2011
Reviews.Content: Rooms look like straight from the early 90s .... bed covers, boxy TV, couch, bathroom.... everything looks old and gives a solid "Motel 6" feeling. On the good side: our room was pretty clean but that's about it. Otherwise it's an absolute rip-off... seriously... 4 stars? Seriously? at least the price is 4 Star... The crack-heads, hobos, drug addicts on Place Dupuis right in front of the hotel come as a free bonus. Very questionable neighborhood at certain times of the day - especially the northern end of the square.... Booked on priceline (name your own price) and the front desk tried to give us a "smoking room" first (yes, the hotel has still smoking floors...welcome to the 90s...) and then after some discussion we ended up with a queen size bed (because NOTHING else was apparently available..)... so be careful when bidding in that area of montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jcsteelesd
Reviews.Content: My partner, myself and a friend stayed at the hotel from Aug 10th to the 15th. This will be my home away from home when I visit Montreal . The staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was very good and even cleaned our suite late one day as we had a late night. You will not find a better location to stay in the city, everything you need is either in the hotel complex or within a short walk or train trip. The only issue we had was the swimming pool hours seem to change with the day, both times I tried to use it, it was closed in the middle and afternoon of the both days. Not a big issue as we had so much other thing to do around the city. We want to thank the staff for the wonderful stay and we will see you again.

Reviews.Title: “it will do for 1 night.”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: As a 3.5 star rating at hotwire wth a "downtown"location - we thought this was the best choice for a mere $90. Little did we know that this"downtown" was the wrong side of St. Catharine with many questionable characters and along the sidestreet and x-rated store fronts. This hotel seemed quite impressive at first as the entrace is gold and marble but unfortunatley - it's all "fog & glass" . Rooms look good but close up, the cleaning isn't up to par and some things don't really work. I would say it was once a grand hotel in the hay days but unfortunately, nothing was kept up. My husband & I were locked in the washroom of our suite on seperate occassions & in the evening, our room fire alarm was triggered in our suite because I took a warm shower. If you don't mind the conceirge busting into your room at night and knocking down the firearm and then warnng you that the vent has be turned on when taking a shower(although the shower light and vent is one light all in one) - call it a night for $90.00!! Bon Chance:)

Reviews.Title: “It was a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Talpurun
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal with my 2 teenage daughters and husband ,and i booked this hotel through hotwire .The hotel was very nice and clean it was centrally located and walking distance to old Montreal concierge was very helpful and parking was 17 dollars and was underground,also internet was free.My only advise is if you book through hotwire and want two double beds call the hotel in advance and request them.

Reviews.Title: “Same or better than 15 years ago”
Reviews.Author: arcturus46
Reviews.Content: This used to be my hotel of choice for its connection to the Berri UQAM metro station. Still has a lovely buffet breakfast overlooking rue Ste-Catherine, and only a ten minute walk to the river.

Reviews.Title: “Dated - but a good location.”
Reviews.Author: boowaaccaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary in July. I booked it through the 'unpublished rates" on expedia for a total of $238 including all taxes for 2 nights. Th regular price for this time period was $150 per night plus tax. If we had booked at the regular price we would have been very dissapointed. The rooms are very outdated with old furniture, out fixtures and old ammenties. We did not find the room to be clean. The furniture had stains on it and we found stray hairs that did not belong to us in both the bathroom and the sitting area of our room. The gym was very hot but at least had some new equipment. The positive was the fact that the room was very large and staff we spoke with were good. Everyone spoke perfect english. The location was also good for us. St. Catherine street at your door step, old montreal walkable, and a grocery store attached to the hotel. The area was a bit seedy with many homeless people surrounding the hotel but we had no issues with them. You can park under the hotel for $17.50 per day or night (not sure which) or walk 2 mins and park for $12 for a 24 hour period (under the library building- which is also where the bus station is). I would not recommend this hotel or stay here again due to how dated the hotel was. I believe for the money I could find a much better place.

Reviews.Title: “Personal belongings stolen, rude service, breach of security”
Reviews.Author: L K
Reviews.Content: This hotel has serious security problems - do not stay here. I had all of my toiletries, some clothing and shoes stolen while we were out and our room was locked and the manager is brushing it off his shoulder like it's not his problem. Whenever our key cards would stop working, we were never asked our names and photo IDs at the front desk - only had to give our room number which should never be the case. Another time, a housecleaner let us into the room when our keys weren't working which also isn't allowed. I wouldn't recommend this place for a second - do not stay here unless you want sketchy service and potential theft of your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend for the price”
Reviews.Author: tiinskies
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire, which said this was a 3.5 star hotel. The last time we booked a hotel in Montreal through Hotwire, we got the Delta Centre-Ville, which was said to be a 3 star, and were very pleasantly surprised with an excellent room that was 4 star quality. With this in mind, we thought a 3.5 would be similar if not better. WRONG. Though the staff at the front desk were very polite, the room was a disaster. The second we walked in we were overtaken by a horrible musty stench. Though we tried to air it out, the smell remained. The carpet in front of the bathroom was all wet, so much so that our socks actually soaked through. Still don't know what that was all about! The room was also very dated, especially the bathroom. We didn't really save THAT much with Hotwire in the end, so we were very disappointed with the price we paid and the quality we got. If you want a decent hotel room at a reasonable price in Montreal, I suggest the Days Inn on Rene-Levesque boulevard east. I have never been disappointed there.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fa96347
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located. Easy to get on the subway. Some homeless people around the area though. The room smelled like it had someone had smoked in the room and they tried to cover the smell up with some sort of deodorant spray. The staff was not that attentive. I stood at the front desk for what seemed like several minutes before anyone even acknowledged that I was there. It was like I was invisible!! Customer service skills need to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and great view”
Reviews.Author: geofreak17
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is downtown nearby Quartier Latin. To Notre Dame it needs 20 minutes walk by feet. The hotel has a large indoor pool -our children loved it. We got a nice room on the 17th floor with a great view over the city. Roomservice and reception was very helpful. Good breakfast location is CULTURES in the mall inside the hotel complex.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and wonderful view from the bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Hadibou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central you can reach the subway in 2 minutes or walk downtown very easily. The view from our bedroom wad amazing. The staff is welcoming and very helpfull. The bedrooms are not so modern but bed are comfortable and the bathroom is clean. A nice place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but time to renovate”
Reviews.Author: Easty-AU
Reviews.Content: The GOOD: location - close to all the action in the Latin Quarter and the Gay District, and right across the road from the subway station. There are also plenty of restaurants/shops around it. The BAD: some reviews have slammed the rooms/staff but we found both acceptable. The pool was the real issue. After a long, hot drive to Montreal we were looking forward to a refreshing swim but were greeted by an overheated pool (it was almost tropical in the pool area) and the water was milky looking. We still took a dip but kept our heads above water. The UGLY: the pool changeroom was filthy with broken tiles and dirty grouting. I wanted a shower after my shower! Minor quibbles - a couple of power sockets not working in our room and unwashed bedside tables (turned the lamp on and it revealed stains from a half dozen glasses). The focus of our visit was enjoying Montreal so the room did the job, but it definitely wasn't 3.5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in bad neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Aja D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, they have good rooms, very comfortable beds and its pretty clean. Location is also very convenient, two block from the bus station,and its in the middle of the city but I would not recommend it because neighborhood is terrible. Lots of young people on drugs are everywhere, especially hanging out in the park which is across the street from the hotel. They were asking for money, sitting on the streets, just awful. Hotel stuff is very friendly and helpful, they let us check in very early( around 9.30am !!!). Pool is really small and its more for kids than for adults, but I have to give them credit because at least it was clean. I do not think that I would be coming to Montreal ever again, but if I would I wouldnt mind staying in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawaxz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the gouverneur place dupuis this past weekend for two nights. I booked the hotel online and thought your website, When I arrived we were put into a SMOKING ROOM!, I had made this booking 30 before the arrival date. When I complained about the room nothing was done or no apology was made due to the hotel being over booked. If I had booked the room last minute it would have been ok to have a smoking room, but this booking was done 30 - 40 days in Advance. Also the shower was not working right and we had to get someone to come fix it, along with that our room did not get service or a change of towels our first night. I was very disappointed in my stay, I had booked 5 rooms all NON SMOKING! . When checked in they had put us into 2 SMOKING rooms. ALSO!! The room was changed out of my name somehow and into another person staying with me. I arrived late into Montreal Friday and when I went to the front desk to pay and give them my credit card, they had changed the booking into someone else staying with me, without either of us knowing. The excuse was " She is New" .

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 3.5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DevilsAdcovate
Reviews.Content: Staying at 3.5 star hotels before in montreal, it was quickly evident that this place was not a 3.5 start hotel. Hell, it wasn't even a 3 star. Pros - Good location. Cons - Old rooms. No curtains to keep day light out. Thin walls (everything is heard in the next room. EVERYTHING) . Loud shower pipes. Dingy washrooms. $17 per day parking.

Reviews.Title: “more than adequate, close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: wea74
Reviews.Content: I booked a "superior" room and called to ensure that it was a renovated room, which it was. It was clean and odorless and quiet, with mid-level hotel furniture and accessories (but with no mini-refrigerator or safe). Wi-fi and continental breakfast were included in the rate. The front desk staff and concierge were accommodating, if not always fully knowledgeable. (No one had even heard of the Mile End area.) I am an English speaker with fair French. Whether I spoke in English or French the staff was equally thoughtful and solicitous. I detected no anglophobic bias. The continental breakfast had slightly more than adequate pastries, poor fruit salad, and subpar coffee. Nice window views, though. With strawberries and other fruit plentiful in Quebec at this time, it is a pity the restaurant makes no attempt to feature the local possibilities. The proximity to the Berri-UQAM Metro stop is extremely convenient. The Metro is very easy to use, a one-day pass is $8 (Canadian), and if you are going to a place near a Metro stop, well worth taking. One buys the pass at a machine. Berri-UQAM, despite being a major stop, had only one machine. You place the one-day card atop the turnstile reader, not in the slot. Most taxis appear to accept credit cards. The Jean-Talon market was a pleasure to visit, although some of the fruit was sour (raspberries) or mealy (peaches). The strawberries and blueberries were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Old facility”
Reviews.Author: mtaylor5
Reviews.Content: On our trip to Montreal we stayed for one night at the Hotel Gouverneur Place Dupuis Montreal. Since this was a busy weekend in Montreal with most hotels booked solid we ended up paying $300 for a double bed room. From what we learned some of the hotel has been updated and modernized, unfortunately our room was not among those and since we had booked through Hotwire the hotel front desk made it clear that we were not a priority. The hotel is conveniently located near a subway station and the walk to China Town and Old Montreal was reasonable. The park right across the street from the hotel seemed to be the gathering spot for homeless and junkies. An elderly woman pulled us aside to warn us about syringes in the park and to watch our kids closely. The U2 concert we saw on this trip made up for the unpleasantries.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for decent price”
Reviews.Author: swetha1988
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting this hotel through hotwire so we got a really good price. everything was clean the beds were really comfy. The staff didnt know anything about tourism or places to go. I accidentally made the reservation for 2 people. I did not know that it made a difference and when the manager saw 3 people checking in we had to pay extra for each night. This was fine and we were completely comfortable doing it however the manager was extremely rude and did not know how to ask nicely. The hotel is located near the Berri UQAM bus.subway station and its walking distance from everything. we never took a cab anywhere. also eat at tutti frutti on the street level as the hotel. Great service and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Beware English speaking tourist”
Reviews.Author: Phtk
Reviews.Content: Language discrimination - if you don't speak French, you will get subpar service and staff give you the run around because they don't want to deal with you. We were told that there is not room cleaning service on Sunday by service desk when we inquired. However, we saw cleaning service cleaning other ppl's room. - the female life guard rolled her eyes, gave us attitude and pointed to sign stuck on the door to the swimming pool when we inquired about the contradictory messages. We were told that pool is opened at 8am. The board outside the pool said opened 8am. However, the door to the pool was locked when we arrived at 9:15am. She rudely pointed to the sign and said pool open at 9:40. We waited until 9:40. She changed the sign to 10am. We were upset and left. Dirty room - windows were not wiped. There were oil smudges. - coffee pot with coffee in it from previous guest. I agreed with all other comments regarding : - low ceiling parking lot, small car space, and lack of spots. -dated Room - overall unfriendly staff. Two star max and I am being generous. Dirty Room

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: mudlover46
Reviews.Content: my roomie and i discovered a bedbug scurrying across my bedspread. we managed to capture it (they are fast) and squish it. this was at 1AM in the morning, so we didn't change rooms. but i was bit during the night on my back and it left a spot of blood on the sheets. the management refused to help out with disinfecting/fumigating my luggage and clothes. i am PISSED OFF!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: Camundongo
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel and I'd say we got our money's worth. Physically, the place needs some improvements. I read that the rooms had been remodeled in 2007, but the carpeting, especially in the hallways was quite dirty and tired looking. The room itself wasn't too bad. I noticed a smell the first time that I entered the room but nothing overpowering. The bathroom left a lot to be desired. In particular, the toilet was old and rather disgusting. The workout room was nice. The treadmills were in good shape and the place was clean but somewhat warm and humid (it was June). The pool was nice and had a lifeguard on duty. We didn't use the restaurants but did check out the bar one night and it was pleasant. The service was always courteous and helpful at the hotel. Having the parking on site was a plus and it didn't cost us too much: 52$ CND for three days. The neighborhood is what detracted most from the hotel. It is situated right on the border of what is called the Quartier Latin and Le Village. To experience the Latin Quarter you have to walk up to St. Denis street and I imagine the night life there is good. Closer to the hotel as you go down St. Catherine street you find the gay neighborhood. Right around the hotel, however, I noticed lots of homeless people near the park that I could see outside my hotel window. Walking down the streets on Sunday morning I did find a syringe indicating that this area might be a drug hangout. Overall, we had a good experience at this hotel, but we would not book here knowing what the neighborhood is like. The homeless were never aggressive, there are supermarkets and small restaurants close by and the Metro is right there to take you anywhere you want to go. Nevertheless, having stayed more towards the west (West of St. Laurent) before, I'd look for a place closer to there.

Reviews.Title: “The place has great potential.”
Reviews.Author: lighthouseboy
Reviews.Content: I only needed a room for one night before flying out of Montreal. I got this hotel for $65 on priceline and I was kind leery about the location. I agree it's an average hotel although being connected to that shopping area with the IGA and Jean Contu is a big plus (esp. when it was pouring outside). I did use the parking garage and it is suit for small vehicles IMO. The rooms are huge and great water pressure in the shower. My view was to the east but I could see L'Homme (Alexander Calder) from my room (it was off in the distance). The bed was comfy but the sheet color and decour of the room is dated. Management could easily update the mattress/bedding, change from tube to flat screen in all rooms and, perhaps, add one of those coffee makers that make a single cup. And replace the carpet. It could complete with hotels like Hilton Garden Inn. But, still, I was satisfied with the room (but, for $65, I can't really complain!). Btw, my remote didnt work so they sent a maintenance guy up. I figure he would just switch out the remotes and leave. He stay to make sure it work properly before leaving. And the guy that check me into the hotel was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit dated but good transport links to get around”
Reviews.Author: BasherWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the main metro station and therefore easy to get around. We stayed for the Grand Prix and it is only one metro stop from the track. You can leave the hotel and be at the track within 20 mins. The hotel bedrooms are however dated and the bathrooms very pokey and hence is really just a functional hotel and not 4* similar to other comments. Other than as a place to sleep, we didn't really stay more in the hotel other than for a swim in the pool which is on 6th floor and hence nice views

Reviews.Title: “Descent hotel, okay location.”
Reviews.Author: KittensFever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Montreal almost once a month. As a young couple in our 20's, we indulge in everything culture related; great restaurants, museums, clubs and of course SHOPPING! The location of this hotel isnt the greatest, it is close to Saint Catherine street so you can walk back from the central shopping area if you like. But you definitely need to take a cab or drive to get to the beautiful old Montreal port area, or the bustling Saint Laurent neighborhood. Not too far, a 10 minute ride perhaps. Exterior of the hotel and the lobby are nice but the hotel rooms themselves were nothing special. In fact, I would say they bordered a bit on the old school side - and Im not talking charming old school chic. But then again, if you're just using the hotel room as somewhere to sleep and keep your stuff its not biggy. Interesting to note, the toilet and bathtub are in a little room and the sink it outside of that room .... ??.... Also I am not keen on the digusting comforters. I'd rather they not put one on at all. Le Cantlie on Sherbrooke doesnt and I find its much better that way. After all, I doubt they wash the bed comforters often. Good to note is that there is a cute little cafe located around the corner (dont remember the name) but you can see it across the street when you exit the hotel. Great to grab a coffee on your way out. This hotel is definitely not my favourite but if I got a cheap deal (let's say $70 or less) I would consider it.

Reviews.Title: “More like 2.5 star rooms, lobby and pool are nice.”
Reviews.Author: woodisgood
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to Metro and Bus stops to anywhere in the city. Pool was very nice and had a great view of the park from it. The room we had was very smelly, almost like a rotting mouse smell. There was an ozonator running in the room but it still stank. If they have an upgrade take it.

Reviews.Title: “Booked on Hotwire (3 1/2 star) - should be rated a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: 052411e
Reviews.Content: I took a quick 1 night trip to Montreal and decided to try a 3 1/2 star on Hotwire instead of the 4 star to save some money. We ended up paying $90 plus taxes and fees for the night for this hotel. After staying at the hotel, I have to say that I think its better rated as a 3 star. When I think of 3 1/2 stars, I think of Radissons / Deltas / Holiday Inns.. .essentially on the cusp of being a 4 star, but with not all of the features. This hotel is quite dated as well - it really shows in the rooms (i.e. the comforter, the decorations, etc). If you want a hotel close to a metro, this is great. It's right across the street from the Berri-UQAM station, which is a major artery for multiple lines. Parking at the hotel is $17.50 - but be warned that if you drive a large vehicle, your car won't stand a chance in the parking garage. It's got super low ceilings and limited parking spots. The room itself was fine. The bedroom featured a twin bed. No issues sleeping on it. TV was in a cabinet,and there was a desk, and 2 sofa chairs in the room. The bathroom was split into two separate rooms - one with the bath/shower, one with the sink & amenities (such as Neutrogena toiletries). The hotel is right across from a park, which during the day is fine. However, at night, I would avoid it alone. The hotel features great & affordable dining options around it. We didn't use the buffet offered at the hotel, or the pool/fitness area. If you need a quick, comfortable & safe stay - this is a good bet. However, would I pay full price for a room here? No, considering the rooms are going for $125 on Expedia. Would I plan a romantic weekend there? No. With that in mind, book carefully. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing four star about it”
Reviews.Author: InternationalNancy
Reviews.Content: The only thing four stars about the hotel is the placard they display next to the front door - must be from at least 20 years ago b/c that's how long ago the rooms look like they were renovated. Hotel smells and looks old. Stains on the bedding. Many better places to stay in MTL.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two days and one night while attending the Montreal Salsa Convention. The staff at the front desk were friendly. The hotel is pretty nice and would pass for a 3.5 - 4 star hotel. The hotel is located downtown and there is a supermarket (IGA) that can be accessed from the hotel. There are some shady people in the neighbourhood at night, but I never felt unsafe. The hotel is great if you want to go go shopping, check out the clubs or hit out to the casino. They are all a short walk or cab ride away. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Clean Hotel close to old montreal and good shopping”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay1313
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent 4 nights at this hotel. We got the hotel for $69 on Hotwire and it was definitely worth the price. Given the location (a bit of a sketchy area of Ste Catherines) Not sure I would be happy paying much more. We went to shopp and although the shopping we were after was at the other end of St. Catherine we were able to walk (a bit of a hike); could also walk to Old Montreal (also walking distance to Place Des Arts) We usually walked one way then took a cab back. A lot of street people around the area. We weren't directly bothered by anyone but made you feel a bit uneasy as it started to get darker. IGA is right there, National Bank, McDonalds and SAQ are all across the street. Room was clean, beds were comfortable. Overall I'd stay there again for the same price. But if I were paying full value I'd want to be closer to downtown (by the Eaton Centre).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Gouverneur place dupuis!”
Reviews.Author: mascot24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last september for a week with a friend. I wasnt sure what to expect but we had a very nice stay at the place dupuis. Everyone was very helpful, our room was very spacious and clean and extremely comfortable. We ate at the hotel restaurant twice and had no complaints about the food. The location was great as we were right beside a metro station which came in very handy! If i was to ever return to montreal i would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasureable elagance situated within a fun bohemian neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: giordister
Reviews.Content: I was most surprised to find as an American that you can never forget that French is THE primary language. This may or may not have been why my final bill was mess with charges for services I hadn't requested or used (e.g. parking) and days I hadn't stayed (was charged for two days beyond that day I checked out). I made the mistake of not asking for printout of the bill before leaving. Eventually, they refunded the overcharges. I recommend just not making any assumptions about the correctness of the bill, and checking the bill thoroughly before departing. That will be our rule for the future. Besides the billing error, I get the feeling that I would have felt more at home and welcomed if I spoke French. The staff wasn't exceptionally friendly, but they were generally polite and service was adequate. The beds were comfortable, bathrooms clean, and room was pleasant with just a tolerably small amount of noise from the elevator. The positive points FAR outweigh the negative points mentioned above. If you want to afford yourself of the bars, festivals, and gay culture in Montreal, this place can't be beat. While we enjoyed letting our hair down and having an adventure exploring all the fun, exciting, and urban neighborhood, it was exceptionally pleasant to come back to a relatively upscale, safe, and sophisticated place to rest and recover. I've stayed at this hotel 3x in 2010, and will definitely stay here again during my next trip to Montreal later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good digs in the Quartier Latin”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked via hotel website for around 90$ (govt rate). Although this hotel is a bit past its prime, the location is quite good, next to the Berri terminal, subway, St-Denis St., and the Gay Village (if you are so inclined). Parking is 16$ which is average for Montreal. Check in was friendly and efficient, we were given 5$ vouchers for the breakfast. The room was typical HI quality, with 2 queen beds, a decent view on downtown, clean bathroom with low water pressure. Free wi-fi, old CRT TV. Breakfast buffet was very good,with crepes with maple syrup, cretons, cheeses, meats, eggs to order, etc...for 15$ (-5$ discount). Gym was smallish and only contained 2 treadmill, 2 bikes, and a weight machine. Pool was OK. There is an ample food court in the Place Dupuis downstairs, with an IGA and a Jean Coutu. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay/Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: CJFromNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Year's Eve weekend. The hotel seemed quite full, particularly with under-21 Americans taking advantage of the drinking age in Canada, although I assume that is the case for many of the hotels that weekend. Even with so many teenagers, the hotel was quiet and well maintained. We had a club level room which wasnt much extra and it was worth the cost based on the reviews of the lower level rooms. Room was a standard hotel size, bathroom had an extra large shower, no tub, which is better in my view anyway. Bedspreads instead of a duvet cover made the room look somewhat dated, but everything else seemed new. View was excellent and obstructed over most of Montreal. The location is excellent. Central to many areas especially the village. I dont think there is a similar hotel that close to the bars and clubs there. Breakfast was included in our rate and was great to have each morning, decent selection and choices were kept full. The neighborhood is a bit sketchy but there are tons of people and everyone kept to themselves. Even walking back in the middle night seemed fine. The shopping of St. Catherine and the old city are all walking distance away, or the metro is right across the street. There is also a foodcourt and foodstore connected to the hotel. If you plan on going out around the gay village/latin quarter and are looking for a perfect location and nice hotel, this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Bein!”
Reviews.Author: sometimestraveller82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November and only found out about this website last week so I thought I would check out the reviews and see if my experience matched the reviews. Well, after reading the reviews all I can say is some people are just totally stuck up. This hotel while yes it is outdated and does need an updated touch is perfectly fine. The rooms are clean, staff is friendly and its located in a very central area. It took my husband and I 5min to get to Old Montreal via taxi, which also arent very expensive. This hotel is also within walking distance of many great entertainment areas and Rue St. Catherines is just a few steps away. I never eat at hotels and rather opt for the restaurants in the area there is a fully functioning restaurant. So either one is a great option depending on what you like. I would totally reccomend this hotel to anyone looking to have a good weekend in Montreal. Also one thing I loved about this hotel is that it is connected to a mall and subway station so if your like me and need snacks to nibble on there is a grocery store connected right to the hotel!! I forget the name now but it is a major chain. The only downside is there is no valet parking and we did pay quiet a bit I reccomend this hotel get valet parking, however your vehicle is still safe in the underground lots. I didnt have a fear of leaving it all weekend and taking a taxi instead. We were given in out rights but that just becomes a hassel. Finally we booked through Hotwire as well and had no problem at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but hotel rooms in need of a remodel”
Reviews.Author: JP58964
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly but the hotel rooms are tired, in need of a remodel....the location is good near the gay Village, quartier Latin and metro station. If you are scared of a a few bums or drug dealer then dont go there.... I have to say that the room service was great and affordable. The room was not very clean, coffee stain on table, greassy and dirty window, rubbish under the bed, Eleveator broke down in the morning, nothing dramatic... But when you pay 350$ for 2 nights you dont want to deal with that kind of crap..... If you have the breakfest included be careful because it is only 1/2 of the buffet included, if you take some eggs and beacon you will have to pay extra... I have been to a few hotel in montreal and for the price of the Gouverneur or even cheaper you migth want to try the Hotel Candlewood suites and Holiday Inn. 191 Rene-levesque Est and 125 Rene Levesque east are one of the best option!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MissK30
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about the location after reading some of the reviews here, and although there were some homeless people asking for money in the street outside, we didn't feel threatened as we politely said no and walked past. We stayed for 2 nights and found it a handy base for exploring the city - walked to Vieux Montreal and Mont Royal. Plenty of restaurants and shops too in walking distance. Good selection at the buffet breakfast with attentive servers. Although some of the decor may be described as a bit outdated, we found our room comfortable and the panoramic view of the city that we had from our 25th floor room was pretty spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: BobLawrence_KS
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, I was informed by a very rude person at the front desk (in my years of staying in hotels, I have never had someone who wasnâ€™t polite and pleasant; this was a first). He informed me that, while I had reserved a room with two beds, they only had one available with a queen. He then told me that they had a â€œsupÃ©rieurâ€� room with two beds, but that I would have to pay an extra $20 per night. He told me that if I had truly wanted a room with two beds, I was required to call the hotel directly after making the Hotwire registration. I found this outrageous, but because I had already paid for the room through Hotwire, I was stuck. If the hotel had advertised a room on Hotwire for $20 more per night, I would not have made the initial reservation. This is a disingenuous business practice. Furthermore, â€œsupÃ©rieurâ€� simply meant that the hotel had refurbished some of their rooms and was charging extra for the ones that had been redone. Because I refused to pay the $20 upcharge for all the nights I stayed there, my colleague and I were obliged to change rooms after the first night there. Normally, when a hotel creates inconveniences like this, they offer something to thank you for your trouble. Far from doing that, this hotel charged me extra for my inconvenience. I have had the experience a few times in my life of a hotel overbooking rooms and not having the room I had reserved available. In every case, the hotel made an effort to accommodate me, including putting me up in a comparable hotel nearby. Never in my experience has a hotel forced me to pay extra in order to get the room I had reserved. In this case, when the hotel overbooked rooms and gave the room I had reserved to someone else, the right thing to do would have been to put me in the â€œsupÃ©rieurâ€� room without charging me extra for it. My attempts to complain were ignored. (Furthermore, the hotel is rather run-down and in a very sketchy part of town.)

Reviews.Title: “One word: good”
Reviews.Author: MarkLBoston
Reviews.Content: This isn't a luxury hotel but it's much better than economy class. There's room service, free wifi, a concierge, pool and exercise facilities, and spacious, quiet rooms. The location is great if you are taking the Metro - a short inside walk to the Berri/UQAM station where all the main lines converge. It's also connected to a small shopping area with a decent food court and a large supermarket, and you are one block from the central bus station. So it's convenient but otherwise the location isn't tops - you do have to hop on the Metro or walk a mile to the most popular shopping and sights. The Gouverneur is currently a frequent Priceline winner, which is where I got my reservation. It's ranked 3 stars there out of 4, and that's a perfect description. It lacks the finishing touches of a top-ranked hotel: the furniture is a bit dated, the TV isn't a flat screen, the lobby is spacious but not elegant. But I found nothing to complain about at all. The view was terrific, the elevators were fast, the front desk people were friendly. I had a very nice stay, and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Met all of our needs!”
Reviews.Author: MONTREALfan03860
Reviews.Content: A great staff and location. Easy access to the metro, bus station, old Montreal, Latin Quarter and the village. Very central to everything you want from restaurants, culture, to entertainment. A super staff from the front desk to housekeeping. We can't wait to go back. The best parking is under the Bibliotheque Nationale which is just across the park.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: 3 travellers in 2 rooms. Some reviews caused me to rethink the reservation, but I went ahead anyways. Absolutely no problems. Hotel was spotless, the staff very friendly, and there was a feeling of a professionally run property in all aspects. Excellent bedding. Location may not be for everyone, but very safe. Full food court and grocery store in mall level, as well as underground walkway through shopping mall to the Metro subway system. We will rebook this hotel again for our next Montreal visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but slightly sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: savannahcat
Reviews.Content: I was in town only for 2 nights for a business meeting. I loved the hotel itself and made use of the restaurant, the business center, and the exercise room. I splurged on a room on the businesss floor which included a buffet breakfast - for 159.00/night - a special rate because I was with a conference. The room was lovely, cozy and attractive. The armoire containing the TV had annoying doors that wouldn't stay open or shut particularly easily, but that was a minimal inconvenience. The bathroom had only a shower in which there was room for at least 4 if you were in the mood to party. I did miss a bathtub though and wasn't told there would not be one. I had some problems with demagnetizing of my key on two separate occasions, but staff were very obliging and apologetic. The hotel is on a mall with an IGA and I was able to do my dinner and snack shopping cheaply, as I didn't have enough time to go out for dinners. The only thing I had a real problem with was the location of the hotel. During my breakfast, I watched a number of drug deals go down on the corner across the street, and the park across from the hotel is filled with people who also appeared to have some pretty major social and addiction issues. That being said I walked easily to St. Denis and up that street toward Plateau Mont Royal and down to Old Montreal without a problem. The service was great, the value for money outstanding. I would definitely recommend the hotel to someone not bothered by being on the edge of some seediness, but centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_Cgy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a convention in September. I had never been to Montreal before and when I phoned to book the reservation months prior, I was told it was a 4 star hotel. Upon arrival, five of us were checking in at the same time. All of us had made reservations more than 3 months in advance. Every one of the reservations was wrong and the poor gentleman at the check in counter was trying to fix things. After awhile he was able to change the rooms to what we had originally reserved. Two of the people in our group were talked into upgrading their rooms. I was in the upgraded room and it was no different than the regular room, other than it having a mini bar fridge. The air conditioning worked great and was a god send with the intense heat there that weekend. The room itself was pretty large with two queen size beds, more than ample closet space, and a small sitting area. The bathroom was on that needs some attention side, as there was mold and the tub took forever to drain. So when you showered, you were getting ankle deep in water pretty quickly. To me they put a lot of money into the lobby, which is absolutely beautiful. It is unfortunate that the rooms look like they have not been touched since 1976. We had breakfast in the restaurant which was a really nice hot and cold buffet. The price was really reasonable and the service was excellent every time. I didn't use the pool or gym facilities, but those who did said the pool was great. The hotel itself is two sided to me, the lobby area, restaurant area is beautiful and very welcoming. The rooms however are nothing to write home about, and I would hope that they would put some attention to the rooms to bring them up to the same quality as your initial first impression. It was disappointing in that I've stayed in 4 star hotels before and this one can't even compete in their category. So something a lot nicer was expected, but it wasn't unlivable. The hotel is located in a particularly depressed area of town. There were many homeless and panhandlers around. On the upside, there were many fabulous restaurants all within walking distance, the train was right below the hotel, and there is an awesome shopping centre and food court right off from the lobby. I will definitely be staying at the hotel again next year as the pros were a lot better than the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: David246564
Reviews.Content: The bad. The hotel bathroom was dirty and old with mold in many places, also needs new grout. The whole toilet was loose, the bath tub would not drain properly, the room door lock was broken. The pillows are unconformable. Tried calling for room service while they were still open, but they didn't answer their phone time and time again. Half the equipment in the gym was "out of service". On the plus side there is free decent Wi-Fi. The tub not draining and door lock was fixed promptly after contacting the front desk, however other issues still unresolved.
