The facilities nearby are good. Under the hotel there is a food court, supermarket, shops and the Metro. But it is not a 'good area', it is really on the out skirts of the downtown area. Plus the kind of people in the area many travels would not want to associate with (let's say disadvantaged people were around). I'm just glad I didn't pay full price for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gouveneur is consistantly excellent.”
Reviews.Author: advisoryHawaii
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times. With a special rate we were given complimentary continental breakfasts. Spacious 18th floor room overlooking the park and downtown. Direct inside connection to the vast subway system. One minor complaint got ample immediate results. They have an excellent inside pool and an excercize room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights there this week. Haven't been there for 3 years. What once held a promise of great comfort, noted for its attention to detail, has become a tired property in need of some TLC. Glasses have given way to disposable cups. Gone are the bathrobes. The bathroom grout needs to replaced. All for more than $155.00/night. While location is superb, they will never again have my business unless they return to the class for which they were nce known.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 1 night on a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: azntraveller
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via Priceline and according to the person who checked me in, he upgraded my room. He asked me if I would mind having a large bed instead of 2 small beds and I informed him that I didn't mind since I was alone. However, the large bed didn't seem all that large (at least not as large as some of the other single bed rooms that I've stayed in). He gave me room 2507 (non-smoking room). The view that I had from the window wasn't that great but in the area of Montreal where this hotel is located, it is typical of the view (lots of buildings and the street). In my room there was a bath robe which was nice. I found the bath robe to be heavy/large and warm. The washroom was a bit on the small side but it wasn't too bad. The bathtub and the sink drained on the slow side but nothing I found worth complaining about. The bathroom toiletries were nice and even though I'm not a coffee person, there was a coffee maker and some coffee available in the washroom. I had problems finding the ice container. It was placed in the closet. There was free wireless internet at this hotel but I didn't use it. Some things that I didn't really like were: - There was no hotel instruction book that I could find. In most hotels that I've stayed at, there would be a hotel booklet outlining the services available at the hotel and the added costs if any. Some hotels also have a channel guide for the television but there wasn't one that I could find at the hotel so I scanned through the television stations to try to figure out where my favourite channels were located. - There is no ice machine on my floor but that wasn't that big of a deal since the ice machine was just 1 floor up What I liked about the hotel: -The location (near Metro/subway station and near Montreal's Grayhound/Voyageur station). In fact, you don't have to leave the metro to get into the hotel (it is interconnected) -There were lots of restaurants in the food court also near the hotel (interconnected) -There was a supermarket (IGA) near the hotel (interconnected) The area where the hotel is located isn't the best but since I was only staying there for 1 night, I didn't really have to go outside since the subway/metro was connected to the hotel. There was a machine in my room that I didn't recognize. Someone later informed me that it was a presser for pants. There were also 2 sofachairs and 1 business chair next to the table. I would probably stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, comfortable, clean, well-priced.”
Reviews.Author: mml9000
Reviews.Content: Gouverneur Place Dupuis is a perfectly good hotel just on the edge of the Quartier Latin in Montreal. I got a great price for a week's stay (first visit to the city). It has easy access by the very clean, quiet metro (subway) just downstairs to all the main areas of town, including the Old City, Mont Royal, Downtown and the universities. The hotel itself is clean though a bit dated. Rooms don't have a lot of walking around room (e.g., my yoga mat wouldn't fit) but are clean and have comfortable beds and a couple of chairs. All staff (and most Montrealers) speak English though some were a tiny bit cranky if you didn't at least try French. Amenities were standard. No particularly good restaurants in the immediate area but lots in the old port and up on the mountain. Carpeting in the hallways older and musty. Ice machines and soda machines on different floors. Parking expensive ($16/day) but one ticket gets you in and out continuously. Pros: Convenience; price. Cons: Gym machines broken; no space to exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tetrazini
Reviews.Content: I was at first leery of this hotel since I've read such bad reviews from visitors on this website. But I was surprised in a good way. We were greeted graciously and everybody that we encountered that worked there was very friendly and helpful and efficient. The hotel room was a typical hotel room but the view we had was awesome. We stayed on the 27th floor and faced Saint Hubert. The blow dryer didn't work and was replaced immediately. The breakfast buffet was very good-highly recommend it if you plan on staying there. Location of the hotel was very convenient. We were close to the Metro subway station or you didn't have to leave the hotel, since I found out later, that you could go underground. We were directly across the street from the bus station to get to the airport. Overall, we had an excellent experience during our stay here. We stayed for 4 days and 5 nights and had no trouble with anything. I would definitely stay there again when I go back to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled...you will definitely have problems”
Reviews.Author: JB-Global
Reviews.Content: So many other recent reviews captured my painful 5-night stay at the Hotel Gouverneur Place Dupuis in early September perfectly. I want to reiterate some of the comments: * The staff (especially behind the front desk) is complacent and careless. * At check-in, I, too, was shamelessly attempted to be upsold a better room. * The hotel is basically a motel in sheep's clothing. Here's some comments of my own: * There's never more than 2 people working at the front desk, not a great thing when the 350+ property is at or near full occupancy. * ...and it could be a really big problem when your room key card repeatedly keeps getting deactivated, as mine did. The staff blamed my "keeping it in my pocket near my cell phone," a problem I've never ever had before. Then I had to fight every time to get access to the Club Gouverneur floors, to which I was entitled. Believe me, I can go on with more bad stuff. Yes...the location is great. The rooms are dated... but are very suitable for occupancy (the pillows I had were notably good). Some of the staff is considerate and professional...for example, housekeepers and room service servers I met in passing. But I'll leave you with this. The front doors are not revolving or automatic...and they are *heavy* to boot. It's a sign of just how welcome you really are at the hotel, folks. Don't risk staying here, even for one night. You are guaranteed to not be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Masseyman
Reviews.Content: My room was not cleaned properly. Staff complacent and disinterested in meeting customers needs. Location is great but the Comfort Inn one block away is actually much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: Ick. I really wanted to love this hotel. Instead, I didnâ€™t even like it. Too bad, because there are some advantages here that this hotel should harness. Rather, it appears the owners have put no money into it for the past two decades. First the positives about the location. The hotel enjoys possibly the most central address in Montrealâ€”where the Quartier Latin and the gay village adjoin at a right angle. The trendy Plateau district and Old Montreal are both within ten blocks, and what isnâ€™t within walking distance is a short train ride away, as the two main lines of Metro intersect right under the hotelâ€”guests neednâ€™t even walk outside as there is a connecting passage through the mall adjacent to the hotel lobby. And since the hotel is a few blocks from the central business district, on the eastern edge of downtown, the rooms on the west side of the hotel on the 10th floor and above have amazing views of the skyline, the mountain, and St. Lawrence River. The city 747 bus from the airport drops just a block away, and even the cityâ€™s bus terminal is across the park. All of that said, the immediate blocks can be a bit destitute, and the stretch of Ste. Catherine just west of the hotel to about St. Laurent can be roughâ€”though the city is doing some street improvements that might help improve things. The hotel started its life in the 1960s as one of the three highrise Holiday Inns in the center of the city. One remainsâ€”the Holiday Inn on the 400 West block of Sherbrooke, and this one became a part of the Gouverneur chain some time ago. I doubt in its current condition it could still be a Holiday Inn, to be frankâ€”as the interior and the rooms appear to have been last renovated in 1989. My roomâ€”1204--overlooked the skyline and mountainâ€”rooms ending in even numbers have the advantageous views, even if the front desk tries to protect/upcharge for those. Be insistent. Then again, the windows were caked in dirt. Despite being a solo traveler, my room had two beds. Few hotels are doing bedspreads anymore, and these were shiny and unattractive. Then again, they matched the rather awful dÃ©cor of the rest of the room. Beds, once you get rid of the nasty bedspreads, are comfortable. Internet is not greatâ€”rather slow and flakyâ€”but it is free. Oddly, the outlets are so old that plugs donâ€™t stay in the wall. There is a business center, but only business level guestsâ€”the facility is on the 30th floorâ€”have keyed access. Go figure. If the room dÃ©cor was dated, the bathroom was just gross. The grout in the bathroom was stained in places, mold was growing on the edge of the wallpaper as it met the ceiling, and the bathtub, shower curtain, and straight rod were ancient. The bathroom sink had a bite taken out of it the size of a half dollar or CDN loonie. On the plus side, the amenities are from Neutrogena, and the shower pressure is greatâ€”makes for a very enjoyable shower. Makes sense in a hotel where you likely feel the need to take a shower frequently. The fitness center is in terrible shape. There are two treadmillsâ€”both out of order the weekend I stayed hereâ€”and four exercise bikes. Then there is a weight machine in clear need of maintenance. The pool is adjacent, and usually filled with screaming kids. I got the room through a Priceline bid for $68 a night, and it was about worth that. Iâ€™d not pay any more than that, and certainly, Iâ€™d opt to stay elsewhere under any circumstances. The sad dated state of this hotel baffles me, as the neighborhood needs a good hotel, and there are some natural advantages this building has. The roomsâ€”despite the low ceilinged bathrooms reflective of its Holiday Inn birthâ€”are not tiny, and as discussed, many have noteworthy views. And as the center of vitality in Montreal continues to move east, this location is so convenient. Other Holiday Inns have been successfully repurposed nicely. . .the owners should visit Hotel Pur in Quebec City or W Buckhead (Atlanta)â€”just to cite a few examples--to see two former Holiday Inns that work well as upscale hotels now. Frankly, I canâ€™t imagine people coming to work in this place on a daily basis, given the state of affairs here. What isnâ€™t worn is dated, and either is bound to be dirty. This is the kind of hotel where when you check out, you hope you havenâ€™t caught anything. Stay elsewhere. And to the ownersâ€”twenty years without much of a renovation is near criminal. There is no way this is anywhere need the four star rating the Quebec Tourism Authority grants the hotel. . .until theyâ€™ve recently changed the scale from one to twenty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good central location”
Reviews.Author: ferngal
Reviews.Content: I have noticed some negative reviews of this hotel but honestly I had no issues and I usually stay in Marriotts, Hilton or Hyatt brand hotels. I choose this hotel because of its close proximity to a show I was in town to see. Only two blocks from the L'Olympia theatre. I stayed in one of the mid-class rooms on an upper floor (there are 3 levels of rooms) and although the decor was a little dated, the room was very clean and the bathroom appeared as it had been recently given a bit of an uplift (new floor and shower tiles). The hotel restaurant/bar looked a little small. Appeared to have some good meeting rooms for business on the main floor. The front desk, conceirge and housekeeping staff were all friendly and helpful. The hotel sits atop of a mini underground food fair and IGA (great for a few groceries) and the subway. Short 10min bus ride to old Montreal and 5min subway ride to downtown. The area around the hotel was ok but I wasn't sure about how safe it would be to walk around alone at night. I would definitely stay here again. I had no issues with it at all. It did seem a little pricey compared with other higher end area hotels, but price may have been fair for Montreal...I don't really know.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you can stomach the filth”
Reviews.Author: beenarounddiworld
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate through Hotwire at 89 CAD a night. Now I see why hotels like this need to use this service. This hotel was billed as a 3.5 but it is MOST DEFINITELY not. Sure, it has all the trappings of a 3.5, like a pool, a nice lobby and an exercise room but if you take a closer look at what goes on inside these rooms, you'll see it is barely a 2 star. Bathrooms are mouldy and disgusting. Bathwater takes forever to drain. Room smelled musty. Carpets were stained, windows don't open-- the screen is full of dust and mould. Bedding is polyester (ew). Everything about our room was outdated and tired. Free wifi was slow at best. This place is need of a serious renovation!! Don't stay here. And if you see a 3.5 on Hotwire for a rate that seems too good to be true, it's probably Gouverneur Place Dupuis. TRAVELERS BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Good backup solution and a 2 Star at the most. Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Streetfacts
Reviews.Content: This is a great example of a nice shell with issues behind the scenes. I purchased my stay via HOTWIRE which I will never do ever again. They rated this hotel as a 3.5 Star and the truth of the matter is that is an OK property, but never and by no means a 3.5!!! Simply NO WAY! Montreal hotels are more expensive than the usual, I can relate to the fact they highly subsidize citizen programs and is all paid via taxes. The good part of the stay at Gouvereur Hotel is that is strategically situated in the Latin Quarters and almost in top of a mayor METRO station and next to a Bus Terminal. The hotel is not a bad property, my disappointment is mostly with HOTWIRE as they sold it as a 3.5 Star when is nowhere near that rating. When I send them my concern, all they had to say was that they visited thousands of properties a year and that they were confident on their ratings. Well... that certainly closed the book for me on any posibilities of HOTWIRE as I find their rating far from true and sad n a way as they just confirmed they have no idea of how to rate a hotel. HOTWIRE relates HILTON, MILLENIUM CROWN PLAZA and similars to a 3.5!!! You be the judge! I would visit the hotel again if I got it at half the rate or way under a hundred dollars. The Gouverneur Hotel is more of a MOTEL than a Hotel. But I would recommend it as a 2 Star. You are better off paying $20.00 dollars more and a known brand hotel. That is my advise after living this experience!

Reviews.Title: “Decor and rooms a little dated, but clean, comfortable, and agreeable”
Reviews.Author: ErstazMatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in August, 2010. The staff were generally excellent, and understanding after 30 hours of travel. Facilities were good, the business center is pretty good. The room furnishings were a little dated, but the rooms themselves were large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: stevew918
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel location for a tourist in the whole Montreal. The subway station is next block (actually there is entrance from the downstairs food court; three of the four subway lines of the city pass through this station); there is a very nice shopping area across from the lobby area (supermarket, clothing stores and many restaurants, etc) and; it is next to the pedestrian shopping block, and so on. We stayed here for four nights, and did not have to drive at all. If you are a tourist, you would fall in love of the location. The receptionist staff was super friendly, the room was clean and spacious; and the bed was very conformable. Additional details: (1) Pick the even numbered rooms as they have a much better view. (2) Subway ticket is about $3 each way, $7 for all you can ride for 24 hours, and the best deal is the $14 for all you can ride for three days. (3) Chinatown is only two stations away on the orange line. (4) Wifi signal in the room is pretty good if you have your own computer. Using the computer at the Business Center will cost you a bundle. Notes to the hotel administration: (a) Although the room was very clean, you may want to remind the staff to wash the nice bay window better and more frequent. I enjoyed the beautiful city and park views, but the finger print marks on the inside and some dirt and spider web on the outside distracted from it. (b) The room furniture is well made, but you may want to start thinking of renovation as some people may think it starts to get outdated. Changing the TV to flat screen on the wall and free up some table top space will be helpful. Adding a safe in the room can be a bonus, and increasing the fan strength of the bathroom will help. Overall, this is a great hotel at an excellent location. I would stay here again next time I visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “The Gouverneur is my favorite hotel in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: clundell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Montreal over the years but always come back to the Gouverneur Place Dupuis. It is my favorite hotel in Montreal because of its price, value, overall quality and location. The various levels of rooms are always clean and quiet with full amenities (i.e. wireless, room service, refrigerators in many, excellent breakfasts, underground parking) and very comfortable beds and bathrooms. The location is second to none - adjacent to the Berri Uqam metro and the Village. There is an enormous IGA grocery store in the same complex as the hotel as well as a drugstore across from the IGA (both very handy, especially in winter!). The hallways of the hotel are carpeted which help minimize the noise levels and the doors open and close quietly. There are six speedy, clean and quiet elevators. The staff is very accommodating and will do everything they can to honor your specific request(s) to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Their online reservation form is very easy to navigate (gouverneur.com) and they also have a toll-free number (888-910-1111) with friendly folks waiting to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, a bit old and dated.”
Reviews.Author: NickAgo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located basically in the center of the village with good access to the subway, bus station, restaurants and nightlife. The view from the room was nice and it was quiet (surprising considering the street nightlife). The hotel overall is a bit old and dated, but clean. The gym doesn't even really qualify as a gym - the treadmills were out of order and there's one old multi-use workout station. The pool is indoors, but looks ok. The room again was dated, with small areas of moldy grout in the shower, but otherwise clean. There was free wireless internet, though it was a bit slow. Service was just okay - nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great food”
Reviews.Author: dlockhart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located for bus, metro and walking. Within blocks of tons of great restaurants/bars; however, is a little too close to the seedier gay section. We walked all over the area and felt safe. We upgraded to the 2nd level room and it wasn't worth the extra money. The rooms were the same size as the standard and the extra amenities weren't worth the extra $20/night charge. Restaurant staff was great. They need another bellman/concierge if they want to be taken seriously as a nice hotel. Whenever we needed anything we had to wait about 20 minutes for the concierge to come to the desk. Amelie at the front desk did a better job of recommending restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: PeddaLAH
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying there. Great service. Attended a conference at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mahdi1978
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by the room I stayed in. Definitely it doesn't fall into a 4 star category. The room was small. The water in the bath tup hardly drains. The room hasn't been cleaned for 2 days. It was also noisy since I can hear the people upstairs or next door. The free high speed internet was very very slow! I won't recommend this hotel. For sure you can find better hotels within the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay In Montreal”
Reviews.Author: barb2593
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Montreal and indeed it was the best location of all. It was an easy access to the Metro station right through the hotel lobby. Also, as an added bonus, a supermaket, food court, and boutiques were along the way! There is a variety of resturants on St. Catherine St., it was a hard to choose where to eat after a long day of touring. The hotel itself was clean, the staff friendly and informative. A definite "Let's go back there again" in our book!

Reviews.Title: “4 stars??? Gimme a break...”
Reviews.Author: Frog-n-fries
Reviews.Content: Despite its great location, we found the Gouverneur Dupuis to be very, very sub-standard. It is badly in need of a renovation. We entered our room, on the 7th floor: it reeked of chlorine. We later discovered it was located directly above the swimming pool (6th floor). The bathroom (which, by the way, was microscopic) was mouldy, the furniture was tired and the carpet tatty. The air conditioning did not work, so we asked to be switched to another room. Second room, still on 7th floor: it reeked of mould, the sealant around the bathtub had gone black in places and was absolutely disgusting. The room looked clean, but a closer inspection revealed accumulated dirt, grime and dust in every corner we cared to look at. This, a 4 star hotel??? Gimme a break. We had only booked 2 nights at the Dupuis via a discount website and had a busy schedule. We chose to stay in that second room (at least the air con was working), but we'll certainly never set a foot in this hotel ever again. Nor will we recommend it to anyone. The only thing going for this hotel is its location: 2 minutes walk to the Latin Quarter, 10-15 minutes walk to downtown. Our opinion: a 2 star hotel living off its reputation. It was certainly popular with Chinese tour groups (think people waking each other up at 6:30 in the morning by yelling in the hallways and slamming doors)... Never again. I am attaching pictures to give everyone a better idea of what "4 stars" means at the Dupuis.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - fairly convenient location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: kweenshaker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the service was good. Upon entering the room, we did our usual bedbug check, but everything appeared free and clear. We needed some extra towels and non-feather pillows and the staff was quick to deliver. The room was a nice size - 2 double beds of average comfort level, nice large sink and seperate water closet. It had all the amenities you'd need if you're on a city break and just need somewhere clean to sleep. The only real complaint was that the parking seemed pricey, considering it was in a smelly old parking garage with no security. The location is great, especially if you are using Public Transit - you can get to Berri UQAM station without even going outdoors (that would be great in the winter!) The walk downtown is on the long side, but ok if you want to see more of the city. St Denis and its plentiful restaurants, cafes and bars is only 2 blocks from the hotel. Old Montreal and the Plateau neighbourhood are only short walks away and the Latin Quarter/Gay Village are right at your doorstep. The wireless was a little slow, but it was free, so I'm not complaining. All in all, a good place to stay if you get a deal but don't want to stay right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable"”
Reviews.Author: Dalestem
Reviews.Content: The bed was extremely low and uncomfortable. There was a huge gap between the mattress level and the headboard. It was very soft and lumpy. We asked for another room but were told that they could not guarantee that the next room would have a better bed. I had a bad sleeping experience and a sore back. The room had a musty smell and the shower had mildew growing. The fitness center was not good and we had to buy access to a nearby gym. The parking gave us the runaround everyday. I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awful parking situation”
Reviews.Author: shoa3c
Reviews.Content: I'm kind a person who can stay even in a makeshift box. As long as I have bed to sleep in, I really don't care about how clean the hotel is and so on, seriously....life is too short to complain. However, I'm making exception this time: I really don't have any issue with the actual hotel; it is great hotel, but a really weird parking scenario. You get charged for parking but there is no where to park your car(it is always full and most of the empty spaces have a reserved sign). I stayed in this hotel for three days and couldn't park my car. I parked on the street during my entire stay. I spoke with a nice person at reception and he cancel my parking charges(remember, I did not park my car). If you drive a large vehicle, good luck parking your car, the spaces are so tight. I wouldn't go back to this hotel, solely due to my parking problems. FYI - Don't get intimated by the homeless crowd outside the hotel. They are really nice people and they don't bother you at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: tv75075
Reviews.Content: I received a great rate for this hotel via Expedia. I stayed six nights in August 2010. The location is excellent, especially for the Gay Village and all of the restaurants in the Latin Quarter. It is across the street from the coach/bus station. It has great connections to the Metro system via the Place Dupuit food court concourse area, which is literally outside the door of the hotel. There is a grocery store and pharmacist shop in this connecting area, so anything you might find yourself needing is three steps away. As for the rooms, think 1970's Crown Plaza. Very clean, but rather dated. The hallways were surprisingly quiet, and the noise from adjacent rooms was minimal. The staff was fine, even when overburdened. The concierge was a wonderful help many times during my stay. This hotel would probably not be convenient if you want to be in the immediate downtown area. Also, if you need excessive pampering, this probably won't work for you. My only complaint during my stay was that the "high speed" wireless was very, very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: friedman29
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is that it is in a good location, albeit a bit sketchy part of town. It is close to the gay village and to nightlife on St. Catherine. But it is an awful hotel. We waited 20 minutes plus to check in, check out, ask a question, etc. Completely understaffed. They did not have our room that we reserved. The room we finally received was dirty. Mold in the shower. The furniture was broken. The toilet did not work. The phone did not work. Eventually we gave up even trying to complain, as it took multplie phone calls and visits to the front desk (wait time: at least 20 minutes) to get any response. We left after two nights and stayed at the Le Meridien, which was a very nice hotel. We tried to switch earlier but could not. Never again for the Gouverneur. A two-star rating would be generous for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Great service - Poor air quality”
Reviews.Author: travellin_lady
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a weekend in Montreal and I chose this hotel based on location and the decent price thru Expedia. I was glad we booked the deluxe room on one of the business floors because the regular floors looked kind of dumpy and were probably very noisy as the hotel looked quite busy. Our floor was very nice and quiet. The view from the 28th floor was magnificent. The room had everything we wanted, safe, fridge, hairdryer, internet, coffee maker, TV and a comfy bed. The front desk staff was very polite and helpful. Parking is about 16 dollars a day and very convenient. You get a ticket from the front desk which gives you in/out priviledges. Although in reality you really don't need a car in Montreal unless you are leaving city limits. The location on Catherine street is great as you can walk to old town, chinatown and of course the length of Catherine with its hundreds of restaurants, boutiques and shopping centres. My only complaint, and unfortunately it's a deal breaker is the air quality in the rooms. The windows do not open, so you cannot get fresh air. This is a huge turn off for me. The AC/heat unit seems a tad antiquated because you are forced to either run the AC or the heating. There is no fan for simple air circulation. I had headaches most of the time due to the lousy air quality. If it wasn't for this problem, I would gladly return...but as I said, this is a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer786
Reviews.Content: 4-star quality and service for a reasonable price. The view of the City and location are great. It would have been nice to have a mini fridge in the room though. Check out is at 1pm which is convenient for those who like to sleep in like me! The pool is nice but closes quite early (10pm) so get your swimming in early if you can. Underground parking is about $16 with in-out priveledges. Free wireless internet was nice and hassle free (no password required)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Joshblaylock
Reviews.Content: My partner were stayed at this hotel for one night. We got a room last minute as we were not pleased with the Grand Plaza hotel that was nearby We stayed in room 1703 The A/C worked great and the staff was very pleasant and friendly. If you're gay, the location is perfect. Right on the edge of the Village. The hotel needs to be updated badly but it was clean and MUCH better than the Grand Plaza. Not a bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wdrefan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times. It's very centrally located, walking distance to just about everything. It's right around the corner from the gay village, with tons of restaurants, bars and clubs and a nice 10 to 15 minute walk to Old Montreal and Chinatown in one direction, and shopping in the other direction. It also has an attached parking lot (fee is separate) that permits you to have in and out privilages if you validate your ticket with the front desk - very convenient. I've never had a bad experience here. In fact, I once forgot my iphone there, realized it three hours later, returned and the maid had left it at the front desk. The buffet breakfast is huge, and may be good if you're prepping for a long road trip (we drive here from NYC), but otherwise it's too expensive. It is, however, quite good and if you have the appettite (which I typically don't), you can do some real damage.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing beats this place”
Reviews.Author: littlelight2
Reviews.Content: Staying at this Gouverneur was a first for me. It was graduation time for my friends and I from McGill and we decided to stay at the Gouverneur to celebrate this event. Reception was friendly, the rooms were proper, spotless and room service was on the dot. The breakfast offered was one of high-quality. Fresh fruits, great relaxing view and very fast service. What truely made my stay unique at the Gouverneur was the service that they offered me and the extra mile they went to make my stay here enjoyable. The hostess at the hotel restaurant, ValÃ©rie, who told me that she just started working here a few weeks ago, even helped me bring a plate of fresh fruits and orange juice to my room. Talk about service. Thumbs up to this hotel and thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “our business meeting point in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: happytobetheone
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I had to arrange a conference in Montreal and we found Gouverneur Place Dupuis through Easy Click web site. We liked the way it looked and the facilities were exactly what we needed, not to mention the price which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Only one problem !”
Reviews.Author: Dee1967
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to Montreal for a shopping trip and booked a night at this hotel. I had stayed here before and loved it for it's location. Reception was great, room was dated but clean with a great view of the city. So we shopped till we dropped and looked forward to relaxing in the room, our feet were killings us so we ordered room service. The food was hot and very good along with the service. After it was time to get some sleep. WELL !!! THAT SURE DID NOT HAPPEN !!! All night long a bunch of 20's partied till they dropped. It's like they were in our room. At one point I had to go down to security ( the reception desk button on our phone didn't work ) to either moves us or tell those people to quiet down. Security did go tell them to quiet down but they didn't . Needless to say both my friend and I had maybe 3 hours sleep and woke up very cranky. We had planned to shop some more but after that racket I just wanted to go back home to Ottawa. The hotel is great. We just had a bad floor with loud idiots. As we left at 8:10am I saw both rooms had the PLEASE DO NOT DISTURB signs on their handle, well guess what , I removed them and hope they get woken up really early !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: fromourhouse
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our one night (weekend) stay. The purpose of our trip was to take teenaged daughters and their friends to the Biodome and go shopping etc. We availed ourselves of the P'tite Folie package, i.e. one room for $132 and a second at $39 -- hard to beat those rates!! Also the underground parking was only $16.50 which is decent for a large city. All in all, it was perfect for our purposes. It was well located in relation to the restaurants on St. Denis; the rooms were clean and comfortable (although not luxurious and the bathrooms not spacious but this didn't matter to us). Travellers from abroad mightn't have been happy with our view, but we weren't there for that either. The pool and exercise facilities were nice and we did use them (no hot tub, but a sauna). The check in and out were smooth with no waiting, although we observed that the line-ups ebbed and flowed. We had minimal interaction with the staff and didn't eat there, so we can't comment on these aspects. We didn't find the area particularly seedy, nor did we have trouble with pan-handlers outside or bedbugs inside. It was good, basic accommodation for a weekend trip and we'd definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: dennikseb
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Gouverneur Hotel when I go to Montreal. Although this time, when we came back late in the night and pulled away the blankets, we found the sheets covered in bedbugs. I have to admit that the staff dealt with this pretty well and offered to wash all of our clothes and transferred us into an even better room. I know this is a problem that happens often and the hotel is greatly located and very adequate for weekend getaways. Breakfast buffet is too expensive and always cold. There are many great little restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: EUReviewer
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby upon our arrival seemed quite cramped and dated, but the staff at the reception were friendly. The hotel's location is fine and especially handy as it is directly connected to the MÃ©tro system and and shopping centre with a supermarket. Our room was of a good size and had a fantastic view over the city of MontrÃ©al. Everything about the room was rather 70s, but it was comfortable nonetheless. The bathroom was clean and the toiletries provided are excellent. The hotel's swimming pool is nice and has a good view out, thanks to its elevated location. When we were leaving, the concierge was quite stroppy in the whole process of ordering us a taxi and dealing with our baggage, which was a shame. However, in all, the hotel was perfect for our needs and it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location good if you like using the Metro”
Reviews.Author: Pairc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Gouverneur Dupuis for 2 nights. We paid â‚¬20 euro extra for a superior room on the 24th floor for 2 nights and we got a cold buffet included in that which I thought it was worth it. Rooms was spacious, toilet was on the small side but was fine. The thing that annoyed us was the water in the bathroom was not very hot. The cold buffet was good, all you can eat fruit, cereal and bread, which we were happy with. Location is just ok but becuase you are above a metro station you can go to alot of places in Montreal using the metro and you can get a one day pass for $9 or 3 day pass for $17 i think. Overall we enjoyed our stay and the staff in the hotel were good. What we really liked about the hotel was we got early check in at 1pm and late checkout 2:30pm which was great and the free wireless was good too.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, pity about the nickel and dime policy”
Reviews.Author: wwwtour
Reviews.Content: I can't ault this hotel on location comfort or service. its not cheap but it offers good value. I stayed in a superior suite on the 24th floor with wonderful view over montreal. So Overall my review must read as very positive. I have one or two gripes. 1st when taxes and parking were added on it put almost $200 on my bill of $640 for 4 days. I know this is part of the CRAZY policy of giving prices excluding tax in both USA and Canada ( and nowhere else for obvious reasons, cos its stupid). But I would recommend using a site that includes these charges or contacting the hotel directly to find the final bill. 2nd They charge separately for breakfast depending on wheather you have a cold or hot buffet breakfast, This might be ok in a cheap hotel but feels very nickle and dime when you have to bring a voucher for breakfast each morning. Which if you forget, as i did, you will have to go back to your room like a bold child and get it, seriously at $200 a night. they can't check a computor in the restaurant or better still have on charge for breakfast and avoid these problems. god forbid someone should eat a hot breakfast when they've only paid for a cold. I mean really. it lowers the tone of an otherwise great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: scott6428
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on top of a mall which was convient and has a metro / subway station attached. We used the metro to go everywhere, we walked to the old city once - take the metro even though it's just one stop. The rooms were adequate with a mini fridge and a small TV. We booked a 'superior' room but other than providing a good view of the city there was nothing superior about it. the staff were all friendly but the desk staff didn't have any maps and gave us incorrect directions. The buffet included is just a cold breakfast but you can upgrade to the hot one which was very good, although it cost 10.75 extra per person. Over all it was ok but I think I'd try something different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location + Price = Value”
Reviews.Author: ScottB_NYC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times over the past ten years. It's always been a good deal for me -- lots of Montreal is just a short walk away, especially the Village. It's also right off two subway lines for easy access to the rest of the city. And while the hotel is fairly middle-of-the-road in terms of quality, I've always been satisfied with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, underrated, break breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Cartervan
Reviews.Content: I had been at the very pricey Hilton with internet at $.69 a minute. moved out to the Gouverneur Hotel Place Dupuis. Only mistake? I booked online ot save $10 by prepayment and this cut me out of Club Gouverneur Privileges Card. The Business Center is accessible via $10 fee which is well worth it. The pool was lovely, the staff lovely ....... Only minor issue, water pressure was less than adequate in my room. Incredible breakfast, simply incredible

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money, nice staf”
Reviews.Author: CanadaGuy1964
Reviews.Content: Only two issues. I booked online and made advance payment thus preventing me from accessing Hotel Gouverneur preferred guest services. I saved $20 online and lost out on everything else including the option of cancelling. Room was lovely and clean, a/c not as good as it could be and water pressure lacking. Maybe 20 minutes to 1/4 fill the tub. A shower was not within the realm of the possible. It was nice and quiet compared to the Hilton the night before. Breakfast bufet was excellent and of incredible value. usienss center was great and private and empty . You are at the start of the gay ghetto which is starting to get tired. The average age seemed to be 65 +/- apart from the hookers wo look sort of drug crazed. Nothing to do with the hotel certaily and it seemed to have excellent polite and cordial stafing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in Le Village”
Reviews.Author: cadejo63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gouverneur Hotel Place Dupuis over the weekend of May 15, 2009. The hotel is a modern high-rise building located at the top of the main street that cuts through the gay village (Ste. Catherine). The room I booked (a standard double #1219) was spacious, clean and well-appointed. The bathroom was small but adequate for my needs. Brand-name toiletries were provided and plenty of towels. The condition of the furnishings in the room were very good and the large window overlooking the city was nice. I did not make use of the restaurants in the hotel, but I was impressed with the warmth and friendliness of the reception staff. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Gouverneur and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for nice accommodations in Le Village.

Reviews.Title: “It was good until we found ourselves unable retrieve something left behind”
Reviews.Author: doins
Reviews.Content: My daughter stayed over your hotel the last two nights and when she arrived home she realized she left behind her flat iron for her hair. Her name is Olivia Mahoney and she stayed in room 906. I placed a call last night and spoke w/security and they were unable to locate it through lost & found. I was told to call back in the morning and I just got off the phone w/security and was informed I was out of luck since it wasn't turned in. I believe the person who cleaned the room should be held accountable and we shouldn't be brushed us off. The second part of this trip involves the travel agent, this agent took a group of twenty high school kids for a ten dollar security deposit for the hotel room and then boarded the bus Friday morning upon their departure demanding another five dollars for the security deposor they wouldn't be leaving and now it's a total of fifteen dollars each person paid for a security deposit. When the group arrived at the hotel they were charged another twenty dollars each and the hotel informed them that the travel agent shouldn't have charged them it's the policy of the Hotel to do so. These kids were a bit skeptical of this travel agent so they called the hotel and confirmed they do indeed do business with this agency. They didn't think to inquire about the security deposit and I'm wondering why such a repitable hotel would do business with an agency that operates in such a manner. I would like to see how the hotel handles these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when using the online reservation system!”
Reviews.Author: pxb123
Reviews.Content: Be very careful when booking this hotel through their online reservation system. When I arrived they claimed that I had booked for December and not November. I had the confirmation from the hotel and they still seemed to question it. I had to stand my ground for the reservation that I made online and was supported by all of the documentation (November date) that their system sent me. My interaction with them seemed to indicate that it was my problem until I refused to back down. They then relented and told me that they were out of the type of room that I booked for (non-smoking, two beds). I had to choose between a smoking room with two beds or a non-smoking with one bed. I choose the smoking and I was pleased that you could not tell the difference. If you have a large vehicle avoid the parking garage. It is very small and the attendant was not very pleasant with helping us. We had to find parking elsewhere. Apart from these issues the hotel was great. I really would have preferred not to have had the unnecessary reservation drama at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Black & Blue”
Reviews.Author: TMHMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel when visiting Montreal for the Black & Blue weekend. Hotel is clean and well located for all the activities of the weekend, plus only a short walk into the old city. Rooms are basic and large and well serviced. Staff courteous & friendly. We used the restaurant for breakfast which had a good selection and reasonably priced. Hotel is not considered a luxury hotel, however well located and clean and meets all the needs for weekend plus well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CarolJJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the annual strike season of hotel staff and the hotel seemed pretty unaffected by it all except for the somewhat casual dress of the employees (trainers and t shirts). Our room was large and comrfortable, with excellent freebies - I liked the mouthwash!. Slghtly old fashioned but it was fine. Breakfast, served by suprerfriendly staff was an excellent hot buffet. The hotel is pretty convenient for the old town IF you know where you are going. Turn left and then next right if you want to catch the metro - or walk into town to the Vieux Port. It's about a 10-15min walk. If you turn left and left into Catherine Street, you hit the Village - the gay centre - which is fun but can be rather seedy.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: marais75012
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at the Queen Elizabeth, which had impressed me on my last trip to Montreal, but since the staff was still on strike, I had to look elsewhere. The conference proposed a choice between the Hyatt and the Gouverneur, and the Hyatt's pool being closed for renovation, we opted for the Gouverneur. Some reviewers complain that the hotel is in a somewhat shabby part of town. I must say that the area is totally safe, and found the latin Quarter with its student atmosphere and bars and restaurants a welcome change from the more sterile business district. The hotel itself provides good value for the money: the rooms are large and well appointed, the bathroom facilities well maintained, and I liked the view (although I would have preferred a room with an even room number, to have the city view). The pool area is excellent, with a gorgeous view (in the queen elizabeth the pool is downstairs on the parking garage level), and I found the bar cozy. I very much appreciated the no-fuzz internet access. I'll definitely consider the Gouverneur on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ViciousKid
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great place to stay very clean. Very friendly staff. Gave me great places to check out since I was new to montreal. Very helpful I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lightning79
Reviews.Content: I was just in Montreal the past weekend and stayed at the Gov. Place Dupuis. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel. The price was excellent, the rooms were well appointed, the staff was helpful and friendly the entire step of the way. If you are looking for a great hotel that centrally located (you even have Metro access from the hotel building itself) then stay here! My friend and I even got $10 off the Sunday brunch for being guests at the hotel. Great buffet and service. I will definitely stay here again in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel EVER! Do not stay there!!!”
Reviews.Author: mw1216
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have EVER stayed at. I don't know who decided to give them three stars but they don't deserve even 1/2 a star. The electricity went out twice in our room, the lady at the front desk pretended like she don't speak English, they can't give you an extra pillow. Our room was directly above the ballroom, and there were loud death music playing till 3AM on a Wednesday night, and the hotel refused to switch us to another room. I guess there is no such thing as service to any English speaking tourists at the Gouverneur Hotel. Do yourself a favor and do not stay at this hotel, I hope they go out of business soon! They're so rude I think I'll avoid going to Montreal period in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: DanNH
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times, and I highly recommend it. I paid about $129/night back in 06, and it's worth every penny. The rooms are clean, large and quiet. HOWEVER, if you get a smoking room, I would like to warn you that you might have problems. I smoke, and the smoking rooms absolutely reek of old ashtray aroma, almost as if they don't clean it after the last guest, though I doubt that is true. It is like a punishment for being a smoker. So, I advise you to get a non smoking room, and take it outside when you want one. You didn't go to Montreal to hang out in a hotel room anyway, right? The location is perfect. Again, it is ideal for gay men, the village is a short walk. Shopping and restaurants are convenient too. You can pop onto the metro right at Berri/UQAM, its only a short walk away. Lastly, the staff is pleasant and polite. Skip the restaurant in the hotel itself. They give you a certificate for continental breakfast. You should have 'un petit dejeuner' at one of the many awesome establishments (Cora, Le Jardin) the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Bad time?? Come back and see it now.”
Reviews.Author: 031811a
Reviews.Content: I know cities and I know hotels. Some are boring and quiet, Montreal is not, especially downtown. The Governuer is especially close to the gay village, metro, shopping, restaurants, and aside from the street people who are somehow tolerated along Ste. Catherine East it seems, the hotel showed no problems. None of the many guests I spoke to had any problem with room or staff. There are other places to stay if you want to be away from seeing the gay clubs, but realize that gay people are not into having things "perfect" all around them, and readily accept people whether rich or desperately poor. Police patrol constantly, discreetly. Come back and try it again if you don't have unreasonable expectactions for the neighborhood around a big city downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PSTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: This is a great, clean, basic hotel in a good location. After having to check out of Sheraton Le Centre we found this hotel closer to the area we wanted to be in. The woman at the front desk check in process could not have been more helpful and friendly. We got an executive room on the top floor for less than our booking at the sheraton. The room was nicely decorated, fairly large, clean and quiet. The bed was very comfortable with great pillows. The views of montreal were spectacular from our room. The hotel is very close to the subway station, shopping and the gay village. We would definitely stay here again when visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A Neighborhood on the Edge”
Reviews.Author: redeco
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gouverneur Place Dupuis is in a neighborhood that very much resembles Eighth Avenue in New York's Theater District...yes, there are pan handlers and peep shows nearby, but so are the restaurants and attractions of the Latin Quarter. As far as I'm concerned, the neighborhood is great. It's convenient to lots of summer activities, shopping, and the arts center and the police presence is strong and makes me feel quite safe. The ethnic diversity is a real plus. In summer, the park across the street is the site for festivals, notably the Nuits d'Afrique music festival in the month of July. Two blocks away is the Juste pour Rire Comedy festival with its carnival atmosphere during the month of July. I've stayed at this hotel before and find the staff helpful and pleasant. The lobby is large and well-appointed, the elevators are fast, and the breakfast, dining room, and bar are good. Rooms are large and well-furnished with large windows overlooking either the St. Lawrence or the large park across the street. Everything is in working order and the amenities and comforts are fine. Beds are particularly comfortable. Water pressure and hot water are good. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody. You'll interact with the city in a far better way at the Gouverneur than at a fancier hotel in a more sterile neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but not Horrible”
Reviews.Author: McBeans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Place Dupuis for 4 days for the Canada Day long weekend. The hotel was clean and so was the room. The price was quite high for what was offered, but it was a long weekend and no other hotels nearby had any openings. The staff is friendly enough, but you do sometimes get the old English versus French issue, but it only happened a couple of times. We had a Superior Room which costed $20 a day extra than the standard room, but it came with breakfast, which was your standard hot/cold buffet. The view from our particular room was awful, one side of the hotel faces a business complex. The parking was expensive, but it was underground. Had a mini-bar that we used to store food that had to be kept cold. The room was not very spacious, but had wireless internet that was very reliable. For an expensive hotel, the decor was dated, but doesn't matter all that much I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Dicey Location”
Reviews.Author: NonaG
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with the hotel itself - helpful staff, generous, spotless room with great view of Mont Royal, decent restaurant, and convenient parking garage, but this is not one of a Montreal's charming neighborhoods! Rue St. Catherine is a sea of strip shows and fast food joints and panhandlers block the street day and night. It's also a long walk to see the historic sights of Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: adelaideguy99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group, for OutGames 2006. It was a perfect location, for the venues on St. Catherine Street. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were big, and the staff were very very helpful, considering the large number of non-french speaking aussies who were staying there. I would definitely recommend Hotel Place Dupuis as a place for future visits to Montreal. The breakfast was cheap, for buffet only about $15. The room we had, was quiet, overlooking the park and high enough to not hear any street noise. The fact that the subway station was so close was great and also the shopping mall with fresh fruits and other snacks was just down stairs also. Only point that i disliked was that unless you upgraded to "deluxe" there was no fridge in the standard rooms. The ice machine was also on the floor above, so it was a bit hard to keep drink cold.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for our group's lengthy stay”
Reviews.Author: tennisone
Reviews.Content: The Gouverneur Place Dupuis was as near perfect as I can imagine for our group's 10-day stay for a residential course in February 2007. There were about 13 of us in residence there in some of the coldest weather many of us had ever experienced! The bedrooms were terrific: great views, updated furnishings, nice bathrooms. Room service was wonderful -- prompt, smiling delivery people. Housekeeping did a wonderful job and responded quickly to requests/needs. A number of us doubled up: there was plenty of space for this. Kids in-room would work fine in the larger rooms. The restaurant and bar were wonderful -- way above the usual hotel fare. Food was plentiful, varied and well-prepared. We enjoyed the French-influenced daily specials as well as standards -- and in a stay as long as ours, with little time outside the hotel for lunches, people were delighted with the restaurant's service and meals. Not one complaint, even from vegetarians. The dining room has corners and nooks where families and friends can get together --plenty of food that kids would love. The bartenders and waitpersons came to know us and greeted us like old friends. Same with the front desk and the concierges, who were very cheery and helpful and could even print out information on directions & destinations at the desk. The hotel is perched atop a Montreal Underground shopping center, and you can quickly walk to the Berri Metro stop, which happens to be a key transfer point for three subway lines. Thus, getting to any part of Montreal is very simple. What a location! We used meeting facilities -- the Quebec Room, in particular. Everything was perfectly set up by the staff and those in charge of our account. We were very pleased by the hotel's flexibility and responsiveness. I used the Business Center nearly every day. For an extra $10 Canadian, you can buy an access card to check your email, print out a document, relax in front of a plasma TV, etc. It's not a giant center, but very nicely set up. A number of folks in our group used the 5th floor swimming pool and the small but very pleasant fitness center. These guests were quite happy with what was available. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers, families, couples -- it really was one of the nicest hotel stays I can remember!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall”
Reviews.Author: DrefromChi
Reviews.Content: The service was great. Everyone was very helpful. The room was also very nice. Food at the restaurant was good. I would definitely return to Place Dupuis if I ever go back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the edge of the gay village”
Reviews.Author: mark_ottawa
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stay at the Hotel des Gouverneurs Place Dupuis pretty much every time we go to Montreal for the weekend, largely because of its favourable location (within walking distance of the gay venues that line St. Catherine St). The experience has proven to be a reliable one--service is efficient and entirely satisfactory, and the rooms are satisfactory. Some seem to have been redone and are a bit nicer--the older ones are tired by servicable. I echo the comments on the underground parking which is very cramped by N American standards. The only cautionary note is that there seem to be a lot of college-aged kids there from the US on the weekends--I have never had any bad experiences with noise, though I could see that happening if you got the wrong next-door neighbour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean, upscale, safe & wonderfull staff”
Reviews.Author: molsoncanadianboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a little west of the downtown core, but it is well worth the stay. Affordably priced and above average service - I think this hotel operates just like a HILTON FAMILY brand ! They are friendly all the time, very polite, and will be helpfull during your stay. Right accross the street from next to the Berri Uqam subway station also helps, there is food, restuarants and grocery within walking distance !

Reviews.Title: “Luv the Guv”
Reviews.Author: Roccobog
Reviews.Content: Sorry about the stupid title! Long story short...Stayed here several times, have never had a problem,always had a pleasant experience with anyone involved in the operation of the hotel. There are some reviewers whom I think would blame a hotel for bad weather (which I had for my entire stay) or blame a hotel for situations that could happen anywhere, but just happen to happen to you at this property at this particular time. It's called life...live it and enjoy it! you're on vacation...go do something. If your entire reason to live is to nitpick every little insignificant thing, then stay home and drive each other crazy! Don't go to another country and keep reinforcing the stereotypical "Ugly American"...but I digress. The parking garage was fine, I'm short and don't drive a tank, so I had no problem. (I only bumped my head once) I had a great time, it's close to everything, you don't have to go outdoors to access the Metro. Last, but not least Roland, my waiter at the breakfast buffet was terriffic. I had forgotten about him until I returned this year. He is cheerful, attentive (crisped my bacon at my request because the buffet bacon was underdone to my liking) anything I asked for he quickly and cheerfully attended to. The Gouverneur should be proud to have such a dedicated employee. Had a great rate 115$ CDN including breakfast buffet, 3rd night was 1/2 price! Parking $16.50 per 24 hr period. Will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: DGlass
Reviews.Content: Well, I've stayed at the Gouverneur Hotel Place Dupuis about 5 or 6 times over the past 12 years. I've also tried various other hotels in Montreal over the years. This is a large hotel, and the location is ideal for some people -- right on the edge of the Gay Village, convenient to the Metro, and within a long walk of Downtown Montreal. St. Catherineâ€™s Street in this area has an impressive array of restaurants, clubs, bars, shops. Rue St. Denis & Rue St. Laurent, with dozens and dozens of wonderful restaurants, are close by. So in my mind, the Gouverneur Hotel Place Dupuis has a very desireable location. Keeping this in mind, I do think that the hotel has been â€œcruisingâ€� on its location. Over the years, I think that the quality of the rooms has not kept pace. The rooms are now quite dated, and the entire hotel could use a complete renovation. The shower really needs to be upgraded. Everything still works, but the rooms seem to be from the 1970s, not from 2006. To compete with more modern hotels, this hotel should consider a major upgrade. If the hotel is not upgraded, some better amenities should be offered, such as free breakfasts (we were offered $5 breakfast coupons, which doesnâ€™t cover the entire cost of breakfast, so we didnâ€™t use them), free Internet access, or free parking. The front desk staff was polite enough. The hotel garage is not at all user friendly, and I'd be concerned if I were to try to drive a SUV, or a car with an antenna. In any event, this hotel will probably continue to be very popular among select visitors, mainly because of its location, but next time, I think I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I've ever stayed at!!! Avoid it at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: DJT_Albany
Reviews.Content: This is by far the WORST hotel I've ever stayed at!!! I wouldn't recommend it to anyone! It was rated as a 4-star hotel on the website that I booked it through (Hotels.com) but it should have been more like 1-star! My whole family went to Montreal for my parents' 50th Anniversary celebration, which SHOULD have been a pleasurable experience. We all stayed at the Gouverneur Place Dupuis, and it turned out to be a nightmare! It was not in the best neighborhood. The fire alarms kept going off (sometimes in the wee hours of the night while we were sleeping); homeless people and drug addicts freely walked into the hotel to accost the guests and beg for money; the toilets, sinks and tubs all backed up in every single one of our rooms; we didn't always get the complimentary soaps and shampoos everyday; and the staff weren't exactly the most friendly. When we complained about all the problems, the front desk didn't accomodate us in any way... in fact; the manager we spoke with was quite rude! They basically didn't want to hear about any of our inconveniences! Customer service is dead at this hotel! You're definitely on own here. The parking garage is a joke too... the ceilings are so low. If you stay here, you'd better have a strong antenna on your vehicle. You have to crouch over to get out of your car and the spaces are so tight! Also, don't expect to find a spot in the garge if you spend a day out on the town and come back after 10:00! Nor are the valets there when they're supposed to be there 24 hours a day! Finally, I had booked all the rooms under my AAA membership to get a discount. I received an e-mailed confirmation of all the rooms and the discounts we'd all be getting, which I even printed the confirmation and showed the front desk upon check-in, but they told us that the hotel would only honor the AAA discount for me since I booked the rooms -- the others in my family all had to pay full price! Sounds awfully suspicious. Avoid this hotel at all costs! I can't think of anything nice to say about it. It's worth it to pay a little extra and stay at a much nicer place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Gouverneur!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Montreal and a great stay at the Gouverneur Place Dupuis. The rooms have been recently renovated and offer beautiful views of Montreal. The staff was courteous and the bellman / concierge was great at recommending restaurants and providing sightseeing information.

Reviews.Title: “It seems that some reviewers here stayed at a different Gouverneur hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CdnWT
Reviews.Content: Hi, First of all, let me tell you that the people in the four previous reviews either have extremely high standards and we're expecting the Four Seasons for 140$ a night or it's something else. I have stayed four times so far since last summer (the last time being 3 weeks ago) and I have a VERY hard time believing these people stories (minus maybe the fire department?). Yes, some of the lobby's fixtures might not be the most up-to-date but again, you're paying a rate of 149$ MAXIMUM on weekdays for a still pretty central hotel. Besides, the furniture, carpets, wallpapers and lighting fixtures are all updated, the elevators are fast and the pool is clean so what's the big deal? Gouverneur doesn't pretend to be a luxury Westin or Omni hotel. I never thought I'd find myself here defending a hotel but after reading the latest reviews, I felt compelled to write based on FOUR good and consistent stays over a little less than a year (and more If you include those of 2003-04). So at the end of May, a group of friends decided to go and celebrate my birthday in Montreal. We booked two rooms at the same time (standard rooms) for the Saturday night and we planned on going out. To make it convenient, I asked If it would be possible to get adjacent or communicating rooms. The lady at reservation said she would try her best and put up a request with the reservation. We arrived on the Saturday a little before 1 p.m even though check-in time is not before 3 and check-out is actually late, 1 p.m at the Gouverneur. To my surprise, they had our 2 rooms ready, on the same floor and actually adjacent! The check-in staff was pleasant and the whole process was quick. Our standard non smoking rooms on the 18th floor were clean and as advertised, just partly renovated. Obvious with the new carpet smell and the actual brand-new look of the carpet. Drapes, bedding and all lighting fixtures all brand new. Mattress was super comfortable, it actually reminded me of the Hyatt Grand bed... so being curious, I lifted the blanket a bit and it is the exact same Sealy pillowtop that the Hyatt Regency Montreal has that I love. I slept very well. The bathrooms have not been renovated yet but were very clean If a little outdated. No trace of mould in our bathroom. No plumbing problems in either room (or in any room I had in fact at this hotel so far, maybe I have been lucky?). We had all the necessary toiletries: soaps, shampoos, lotion, shower cap and even mouthwash, a toothbrush, a sewing kit and a shoe sponge in a standard room! The usual three clean large towels provided and I made a mess not realizing part of the shower curtain wasn't completely tucked in the tub. When I called for towels, three more were brought up (even though I had asked for one) within 10 minutes. Powerful shower. Basically, I really have nothing to say for the price paid. We went to swim before dinner and the lifeguard was very pleasant. The change rooms are clean but outdated. Breakfast: I did not feel rushed by the staff. Our waitress was pleasant and fast in her service. The buffet was good and filled with every possible choice as usual. She did not rush us out like mentionned previously and to be quite honest, I have never skipped that buffet for three reasons: the food is always good, the service is equally up to par and for a downtown Montreal hotel, at 12$, the price is more than reasonable for a buffet. To summarize it, this was another good stay at the Gouverneur. Rooms are always clean and I've never had any sort of plumbing or coffee/toiletries supply problems. Staff is pleasant, particularly Judith at the reception and the young Concierge (can't remember his name). When in the lobby, he overheard me trying to explain to my friends on how to get out back on the 40 and he offered a map and to take over so I could get out of the hotel. I thought this was very nice of him. They have never refused to honour the different rates I have booked and I have trouble believing that they would let punks and beggars in. How is that possible when there is a visible security guy in the lobby both during the day and at night? I can certify that I have never seen people from the park in front of the hotel come and trouble guests inside the lobby and even at the doors. I am sure with the firm alarm, some kind of compensation was offered or given. I am sure they could have done something given I always have been replied to when giving comments on their comment card. They seem to value their guest's feedback. The parking garage? Well, seriously, the ceiling is low that's true! But the Place Dupuis mall and office complex was built in the 1950s. What do you want the hotel to do about that? Dynamite the building so they can increase the ceiling by 2 feet? You're never more than 45 seconds (no exaggeration!) to the elevator. I'm 5'9 and I don't have to bend to walk. And finally, YES, the hotel is in the GAY village. It is a member of the IGLTA and it's even on their website. So expect to see homos. Unfortunately, yes you see homeless people in the park up front but you also have a beautiful view of the downtown Montreal skyline. It's not a dump nor a depressing hotel but don't expect the W! This is a local Four Points, Courtyard or Holiday Inn Select style hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - I was 1 of the party of 5 rooms with 'Drop the Stars'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that it was an unpleasant stay and I would NOT recommend anybody stay at these accommodations. As 'Drop the Stars' mentions in their review, some of the staff at the front desk (not to mention some of the dinner wait staff) are not very friendly or accommadating. They did not honor the Triple A pricing for 4 of the 5 rooms. They did not want to help their guests with anything. (As if they had a 5 point checklist stuffed in their front pockets. Anything not on that list they could not do) The hotel has very bad plumbing. In the 3 days we were there, the toilet in my room backed up 2 times. Two other rooms toilets backed up as well. Need I go into any details as to why this could be an embarrasing situation? The room next to mine had the sink clog twice and the room across the hall had a clogged bathtub. Cudos to the maintenance department? Does management intend to address this plumbing problem? The hotel's competition must own major shares in Canadian Roto Rooter stock. Then there is the issue of the fire alarm sounding off at 4:00 a.m. It was going for an hour. When I called the front desk to ask if everything was all right, their response was in a monotone voice only Dick Cavitt could imitate in one of his monologues. "Please stay in your room sir, it's a false alarm. We are having trouble resetting the alarm." Meanwhile, the wide eyed guests from the upper floors are frantically herding down the stair wells in what I would say was not an organized or calm fashion. After an hour or more of this, the alarm quiets, but you can still here it on the upper and lower floors. After another hour those alarms quiet down. Everthing is now quiet........so we think. Now a different alarm sounds off much louder then the first (similiar to a W W I I Air Raid alarm). Am I supposed to trust the person at the front desk who happens to be on the ground floor, that everthing is OK? That alarm finally quiets down. Oh, look at the clock, it's time to get up. The day before we walked into the hotel lobby only to find out we could not go to our rooms. There were about 30 Canadian firemen blocking the elevators. They were checking for smoke with their meters. This ordeal went on for hours. It ended up someone released pepper spray. Toiletries, what can I say about toiletries? Will I get my soap today? What about my complimentary coffee packets? Or will I have to ask one of the other rooms for theirs again. One room requested toilet paper the night before, they called 3 times and finally received it at 9:30 in the a.m. There were 4 people in that room. They had to use toilets from some of their travel mates rooms. The parking garage is a joke. If you stand taller than 6'-2", I hope you have a good back, because your walk to the elevators will be in a crouched position. The locals seem to use the garage too. You may be forced to use valet or another means for parking. The parking attendants don't speak English or French. When I went to the front desk to complain , they basically didn't want to hear it. They offered no comps or price breaks for the miserable stay. I could continue on about this frustrating experience, but instead I say this. Don't stay at this hotel unless you look into it thoroughly. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “A Dump Is an Understatement!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, the rate we were qouted was not accurate. That same evening there was fire department activity, no one was told what was going on just that we couldnt return to our rooms. The next morning (5:35 a.m.), we were woken from our beds by the sound of the fire alarm again and people running down the fire escapes. Once again we were not really clued in on what the problem was. During the course of the stay out of the six different rooms we had occupied, five of the toilets backed up. Although they were quick to fix them, it was still an ongoing problem. If this wasnt enough the problem of the homeless outside the hotel (oh and the occasional straggler inside) was horrible. The area the hotel is in is not a family friendly enviroment, unless you dont mind watching someone climb in a garbage truck to get there belongings out. The best thing about the hotel was the breakfast buffet, but thats only when they dont hand you the check and rush you out.

Reviews.Title: “Drop the [--] Stars Curt,rude staff, smells problems etc.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very disappointing experience for my whole family. We grouped for an anniversary trip, my parents 50th and booked a total of 5 rooms. All 5 had problems. 3 had overflowing toilets, 5 had problems receiving necessary items such as tissues or toilet paper...do we bring our own? Breakfast was great with vouchers make sure you get them or you pay. Our group consisted of my parents,(seniors) my family,adults teens and my brothers with their toddler children. On a nightly basis the fire alarm goes off and it seems to be handled like its no big deal as customers are pouring down fire stairwell at 4:30 in the morning in fear of their life waking to this and finding elevators are in lockdown because of the alarms. We were put through this for three nights. Thinking it was a glitch in the system or one of the druggies from the square coming in and setting off the alarms. The homelessness and dereliction in the park is the view from any window in front. My disappointment continued as beggars enter belching and begging money when you leave the mezzanine level to exit the lobby!!!!! The parking garage bend over to carry luggage as you exit. Minivans and suvs need different levels to park. Some personel from front desk and some waitress's very curt. I don't expect to be hounded while eating my breakfast and a bill is placed in front of me asking 3 times if I am ready or do I need a pen or something. No I was still having a croissant & my coffee! Wish I read this website first!!! My parents 50th anniversary was memorable for different reasons now.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Dump! Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Tam1904
Reviews.Content: We got in for the GP Formula 1 prize weekend and we had bought a very expensive package from an agency. This place was in a horrible neighborhood, full of junkies and shady people. The lobby was already depressing but the rooms were unbelievably dingy, stinky and super-depressing. Our first room smelled of stale smoke (we had asked for non-smoking) and had cobwebs coming from the lamp. Every time someone in the street let out a scream (which was pretty often),you could hear it all the way in our room...both my husband and I were disgusted and asked for another room. They switched us to one facing the inside but it was still absolutely horrible and depressing.
